reviews.text: Went here May 29, 2020 on a Friday. They were allowing customers to dine in. It was great... service, safety, food, and cleanliness. Coming out of quarantine was already difficult, but this location made things easy for staff and customers.

Another day, another cheesecake.  We decided to grab some dinner this past weekend and settled on CF. We generally always go to the Easton  location but went to the Polaris one this time around.  The restaurant itself isn&#39;t quite as big but it&#39;s busy and a fun environment. My favorite part about this menu is how insanely large it is. I ended up getting  the Philly  cheese steak, which was fantastic. Then my wife and I split the tuxedo cheese cake, unfortunately we ate our food before I got a picture but I did grab one of the delicious cheese cake. We love this place.

Did I already mention that I love chain restaurants?  There is something I really enjoy about knowing what you are going to get and the food tasting the same every time.  I know....kind of boring.  <br><br>The notoriously long menu here really seems to be love or hate, but I love it.  So many choices!  This time I tried the shepherds pie and it was amazing.  Hot and filling with really fresh vegetables.  It tasted like it had red wine in it as well.  Also if you like having leftovers for lunch the next day, this is your spot.  <br><br>We went on a weeknight, so there was no wait to be seated and service was excellent.  Some fun holiday cheesecake varieties in the dessert case almost tempted us, but we were too full.

Bad experience all the way around. I went here today to take advantage of happy hour. I was out on the patio and they told me that I couldn&#39;t take advantage of that pricing because I was not at the bar. I asked in light of the current pandemic if they would make an exception and they said no. I was willing to except that. Although I thought it was kind of crappy. I continued to order the way I was going to order anyways. I then asked if I could get half of a cheesecake to go. I asked if I can get one that is not frozen.  They had enough slices to do so but they told me that they were unable to do it because they would only sell it to me frozen. When I asked them to please give me the unfrozen half they didn&#39;t want to do it and the manager was terse. When he came out to speak to me he was very short condescending and didn&#39;t seem to want to hear what I had to say but just offer me his explanation for not wanting to do the things that I wanted. I told him that maybe he should ask me why I wanted to see him before he started telling me what he couldn&#39;t do. He told me I was getting greatly worked up over this.   In the end he ended up giving me half of a cheese cake unfrozen cheesecake which I paid for. When I brought my cheesecake home there are pieces of paper stuck in my cheesecake as you can see for the picture I posted. The server that I had was very kind he came in it was a substitute server for the one we were supposed to have come to our table for over fifteen minutes. His name was Harrison. He was the real MVP.  Brian was the manager who reluctantly took care of us.
We sat outside. The food was fantastic. The covid precautions felt safe. They preferred that we view the menu on our phones but brought a paper one when asked. Friendly service.

We stopped in on a whim and did not know what to expect.  We try to avoid chain restaurants and prefer fresh healthy options.  We were pleasantly surprised.  They had a great decor, a stunning, large and modern menu, and lots of heathy/plant based options.  Our waiter seemed really busy, which is no surprise during covid, but was fantastic and tried really hard.  The food tasted nothing like a chain restaurant (i.e. prepared in a factory, reheated from frozen, and then slapped on a plate under a heat lamp).  Instead everything seemed fresh.  At least the things we ordered.  The only complaint is that the fries tasted like McDonalds, which was great when I was 11.  Today we look for more creative presentations and flavors.  Otherwise we loved it.  Thank you CCF for making a chain restaurant really pretty good.

My husband and I just had the most amazing lunch.   We just stopped after traveling from St. Louis and wanted a nice meal.  My husband ordered the Breakfast sandwich that was fit for a King.  It was made on toasted Brioche bread,bacon,ham,cheese, eggs, mayo and a slice of fresh tomato.  I had Tuscan chicken entree from the skinny Menu.  There was nothing skinny about the taste.  It consisted of boneless chicken breast with a sauce made of roasted tomatoes, capers , artichokes and basil .  To top it all off I had a red raspberry cocktail.   Our server Naomi was excellent.  She was very attentive and personable .  If you happen to dine here make you ask for her.

Made us wait an hour just to sit us outside. Not clear or helpful with putting your name in for reservations of any sort or anything. They need to work on being clear with seating an options when people of the party have medical conditions.

The service sucks from the hostess to the waitress who never followed up with me. I ordered the guacamole salad and added steak....the steak came out raw. I ordered cheesecake and it took 30 mins to come out.

While I understand the new world of Covid and dining, however when my food arrived cold (mash potatoes hard from sitting under the heat lamp and Madeira sauce on chill) I asked to have another prepared. The manager brought my food back....SAME PLATE REHEATED AND HIDDEN JNDER EXCESS CHEESE...<br><br>That&#39;s seems unhealthy and dangerous during the pandemic to take food already eaten off of and put in back on the grill or in a microwave where other food is prepared ....DANGEROUS...<br><br>And I&#39;m still waiting on my new plate...<br><br>I think this location needs a break.

Went here with a gal pal for a small lunch after a shopping day. Nice staff, and we actually got seated pretty quickly. I got the fried mac n cheese and she had the Buffalo chicken tenders. The chicken tenders portion was extremely generous, which we were happy about. Our biggest gripe with the meal was that there was too much breading on both the mac n cheese and the chicken. On top of that, the mac n cheese didn&#39;t have a ton of flavor, which was pretty disappointing. This probably won&#39;t be my go-to place, but I&#39;d come back and try something else.

UPDATE: I was gonna take this to my grave, but it has now happened TWICE. This is the second time in a row where a glass has been shattered around the edges of my beverage. I went to this location a couple of months ago and a jagged corner of my glass cut my mouth. I went to the manager and she was so remorseful and gave us our meal for free that I wasn&#39;t going to hold it against them; after all, they were going to replace all of their glasses as well as retrain employees about checking the cups before they&#39;re on the floor.... you would think. I also laughed it off thinking, &#34;what a weird fluke!&#34; Is it a fluke though? Apparently not.<br><br>I went there again and obviously checked my glass. It had a huge slice taken out of the rim, sharp as glass (pun intended). NO JOKE. I was furious! Luckily I noticed it was sharp and didn&#39;t hurt myself, but it really could have hurt someone! They obviously don&#39;t care and it&#39;s flat out dangerous. I told the manager, a different one, and he gave me some flimsy smile and took my meal off the bill, still charging my wife. Whatever. I appreciated that, but there&#39;s no excuse for it happening twice! No one should be subject to stitches while they&#39;re enjoying dinner.<br><br>I&#39;ll never go to this location again and good luck if you do.

I really enjoyed my last experience at the Cheesecake Factory. Maybe because of the people maybe because of the food. The menu is very overwhelming which is why I did not put 5 stars as there is so much to choose from that I could not pick. I ordered chicken parmigiana which was a great pick as the chicken was cooked to perfection. Everyone enjoyed their meal and I finished it with some chocolate cheesecake to go. Definitely recommend

I&#39;m super surprised at how very bad the service was.  Especially in this time of Covid where people aren&#39;t going out.  I met a friend of mine for dinner and have ordered a bunch of things, they took forever to come out, not once did the server ask us how our food was and we have been here over two hours and not had our drinks refreshed.  They are still in business in spite of themselves.    Not coming back, good luck CKF

Good Food, Great Service!<br><br>They have an expansive menu so they have something for what ever you have a taste for.... oh and they make pretty good cheesecake !!! <br><br>I ordered the Salmon as my entree, and it was taking a bit longer than expected to come out, so my waitress &amp; the manager comped me a salad while I waited for my Salmon to come up. <br><br>I love that their selection of cheesecake is always changing while they also maintain a list of &#34;regulars&#34;.
The Bang Bang chicken and shrimp is by far the tastiest dish I&#39;ve tried. The mango key lime cheesecake is my absolute favorite!

Well, didn&#39;t start off well. We had a reservation and they apologized and asked if we would want to sit at a high top bar table.  Um, not with our son. Great host &#39;found&#39; a table. I am sure he asked  a server friend to &#39;pick us up&#39;. Whatever, at least we had a table. Server friendly and efficient enough. Bread (that we love) didn&#39;t come out until AFTER our appetizer and main courses were served. Food was hot and good. Host and server made points up because it was my husband&#39;s birthday.

We had a delightful takeout Tuesday at the Cheesecake Factory. My wife kindly served as my &#34;get away driver. Dropped me off in the front of the restaurant while she picked a close by parking space. I went inside and found the &#34;social distancing carousel&#34; around what is typically the welcome desk. Literal red tape kept us each in our boxes as the prior person got their orders. We hadn&#39;t heard of the free cheesecake slice promotion they are offering on orders of $35 or more, and it certainly wasn&#39;t proactively offered on the website so we paid full price for our two delightful cheesecakes, the pasta carbonara and buffalo blasts. The food was packed well, and I liked that they had different areas set up based on where the order had been placed. I never thought I would look forward to sitting in their shockingly uncomfortable plastic chairs, but it will certainly be something that brings me joy once &#34;social distancing is in the books.&#34;

It&#39;s been years since I&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory and will likely be even longer before I go back again. Not because I had a bad experience or because the food was awful but because it was just average food with an above average price. I ordered the buffalo wings which were less than stellar. I also had the shrimp with angel hair pasta, also average. And the loaded baked potato tots were decent. We had great service but that was the only thing memorable.

Food is mediocre and seating is average. Has so much potential to be the best restaurant in Columbus. Our particular meals were fettuccini Alfredo and spaghetti with meatballs. Both meals could have been prepared better. The cheesecake on the other is the most amazing cheesecake I&#39;ve ever had. Still a great place to dine-in

We went for a birthday celebration, and it has been the best service we have received. Workers wore masks, which ensured their need to protect themselves and others from the spread of COVID-19. They also provide sanitizing stations at the front. <br>One order did come out wrong, but they gave us a free cheesecake on the house, which showed they really care for their customers. The servers were also very sweet which made the experience a whole lot better. In conclusion, it was a really great experience with good food and good service. We will definitely come again.

I love this restaurant. Not only are there unlimited choices... it&#39;s reliable. I pretty much order the same few things everytime I go, because they are always so good!!! This is my favorite chicken Caesar salad of all time (BOLD STATEMENT I KNOW)! I also love their fries, which I usually get, but opted for the burrata instead. I had never tried it before there! I thought it was pretty good. It doesn&#39;t come with anything (bread/cracker wise) though, but our waitress had some of the sour dough Bread cut up thin for us! I would definitely order it again if I was in the mood! My fiancé always get the four cheese pasta and adds chicken. I didn&#39;t try it but he told me it was good. We both ordered the lunch sized portion of our dishes and it was more than enough. Both ended up taking home leftovers. FYI, this salad is so good, it&#39;s good the next day too!!!
We had 6 in our party and were seated promptly at our reservation time on a Saturday evening. The service and food were very good and we will return.

I&#39;ve been coming to this cheesecake for a while now since I&#39;m a local. Out of about 50 times I&#39;d say 45 of those I&#39;ve received very slow, nonchalant, and uncaring service. Food is good so I come back but I&#39;ve reached a breaking point to where I have to give the negative review. I waited in a long line to receive my order tonight then afterwards I asked them to bring me a extra Parmesan cheese (as I usually do because when I place my order I always ask for an extra and they always forget). After waiting in a long line for 20 minutes I waited another 20 minutes to get my cheese. There were a lot of employees that were doing nothing at the time and heard my request and decided to ignore me. Unacceptable and unprofessional but whatever. I&#39;m sure it&#39;ll continue. It is what it is.

Horrible service today at 4:45 pm. Waited and waited for all aspects of meal. Ordered 2nd cocktail that never came. Manager never offered free anything.  Server talked us into ordering to go cheesecake from him instead of up front. We are still waiting after 40 minutes for our &#34;to go&#34; cheesecake. Last time EVER eating here

Came here with a group of colleagues my first week on the job in Columbus on a Thursday for a group lunch.  We found parking easily and it wasn&#39;t a long walk to get there (thank you Barnes and Nobles for letting us cross through).  When we reached the restaurant, we were promptly greeted and seated in a nice quiet section of the restaurant.<br><br>Our waitress was a gem, she took our drink orders quickly and then told us some of the specials and some of the items that they ran out of (and joked with us saying well there are the other hundreds of items to choose from... she had the exact number which was impressive).<br><br>We waited a short while for our drinks and bread to come but once we were situated she took our orders.  Our food thankfully arrived quickly to our table.<br><br>We ordered the avocado and chicken rolls for the table as shared apps, both of which were delicious and nice and crispy on the outside but not super greasy either.  The dipping sauces were a great add to enhance the flavors.<br><br>For my main course I ordered a jambalaya type dish off of the lunch menu.  It was tasty with a nice kick!<br><br>The waitress also helped a few of us whose coats ended up sliding off and onto the floor, I learned something new with how to secure your coat on the chairs there!<br><br>While it&#39;s certainly not an every day lunch spot for me, if I had to gather the team for a close by lunch outing, this place would be on my go to list again!

Some friends and I recently had lunch at The Cheesecake Factory and it was good.  For this reason, we decided to place an order for delivery with the restaurant. <br><br>We placed an order for 1 entree &amp; 2 orders of &#34;warm apple crisp&#34; from the menu.  We understand that ice cream doesn&#39;t travel well, so we advised to skip the ice cream.  When the order arrived we found two ice cold containers of dessert sitting on top of the driest spaghetti I&#39;ve ever seen.  Not a drop of sauce to be found.  <br><br>The apple crisp had been taken right from the fridge but there was no &#34;crisp&#34; to the dessert.  What we received (for almost $20) was two containers of cold spiced apples.<br><br>When I called the restaurant they tried to justify it by saying it is their policy to send it cold.  What? I&#39;m paying the same as a customer in the restaurant so I deserve to have my food served the same way.  My spaghetti didn&#39;t come to me with the intention that I have to warm it up, why should my &#34;warm&#34; apple crisp (minus the crisp) be different?<br><br>Do NOT order delivery from this restaurant.  I got platitudes and excuses from the manager.  That doesn&#39;t help when I just paid $50 for inedible food.

Over priced. Over rated. Glorified Ocharleys with a larger menu. Why is the eye of Sauron everywhere? Get your shot together Cheesecake Factory. It ain&#39;t 2003 anymore. Lower your prices and stop posing as a fancy restaurant. Ps your bread is always stale.

To say that this place is disorderly would be an understatement it is entirely loud. Seating is minimal to none on a Friday evening with ridiculous waiting hours Between 1 to 2 hours before you can even get a seat. This restaurant is not kid friendly just because the atmosphere it&#39;s not kid friendly due to the fact that there Are unreasonable waiting hours. So far the restaurant seems extremely understaffed today. The hostesses dressed inappropriately and talks to the customers in an unprofessional manner. If you&#39;re looking to have dinner and a quiet atmosphere this place is not it.<br><br>On the plus side. The food is exceptional. The restaurant caters to people with genuine food allergies, and offer a variety of gluten free dishes. For that reason I would recommend this place however, they should really get the noise under control and have more coordinated staff.

This week, I took my family to celebrate something special and The Easton location was a big disappointment. Specially the quality of the food.  Pasta was gummy, obviously just a plate full of not-fresh bow ties. The cheesesteak sandwich was 90% baguette.  Dry, And again, sat too long waiting for the other orders to get finished.  <br>Family celebration for a new grandson would have been better at home. Not a positive visit.  Probably the last..
Very poor service and very rude front door Hostess at the Polaris location. Will never go back there and spend my money again.

The worst experience ever!!  A hour wait that had reservations set, another hour just to place a food order. Received food which was suppose to be shrimp scampi. No sauce just some VERY dry noodles with shrimp on the side. The whole group that i was with complained about their food. I sent my plate back. Definitely didn&#39;t want that mess!!! Most certainly done with food chain restaurants.

Though I love the Cheesecake Factory, service was mediocre and exceptionally slow and the House wasn&#39;t full. The presentation of the food is excellent and it was delicious. We had only one complaint. We parked at a meter with a max time of 90 minutes. Our food came 12 minutes before the meter expiration. What do we do? Leave our food to get cold to walk to the meter or risk getting a ticket? I would definitely come back.

Overall the experience was a four.<br>1. Service was very mehhh.  I asked the waitress what she thought about the Mediterranean Chicken and she said:<br>No but that is only because I am picky..<br><br>Lol, what did that mean????<br><br>2. I ordered a latte, the Mediterranean Chicken (yes, inspite of the not so glowing review I still tried it), and did salad.<br><br>The latte was OK.  I would not order it again.  I came in a tall glass?? Confusing. See pic. <br><br>The Mediterranean Chicken was awesome.  Highly recommended.  Health, light, and flavorful.<br><br>The side salad was enjoyable.  The  vinaigrette was refreshing.<br><br>Inspite of my preconceptions I was pleasantly surprised.

Come for the Cheesecake!! Stay for the lovely decor. Food is also good but I prefer the cheesecake for sure.<br><br>I like the Cheesecake Factory for the great service and atmosphere that the restaurant provides. But please mind that this isn&#39;t a Guild House type restaurant. It&#39;s low key, and lovely.<br><br>Two stars, for a couple of reasons.<br>1.) Some of the workers look as though they could be elsewhere and pointedly ignored a couple customers.<br><br>2.) They had some desserts sitting out for about 5 minutes in a busy area.<br><br>I worked in restaurant and currently work at one and we would get in trouble for things like that. But most mainstream restaurants can be like that when it&#39;s a busy night.<br><br>There was a nice lady who finally helped others waiting for more than 10 minutes for a single cheesecake. She was clearly doing other peoples jobs. I like CCF but this was a rare miss. I am sure it&#39;s not always like that.

So honestly, who doesn&#39;t really enjoy The Cheesecake Factory? I really don&#39;t expect anyone to speak up. Because they do everything so right. The worst part about the factory is the wait. Expect to be waiting some time for a table to free up. Also the place is pretty noisy which can have a negative effect as well. But that&#39;s it for the negatives!<br><br>Now to the food... it&#39;s pretty good. They have a HUGE selection of foods from different cultures: Asian, American, Spanish, Italian ... etc. so there is definitely something for everyone. But sometimes the menu can feel overwhelming. I find myself having a difficult time deciding between exactly what I want. I&#39;m not saying that as a negative thing. But just a &#34;FYI&#34;. I&#39;d rather have more choices then less. I often find myself on the pasta side of the menu (I love pasta). I&#39;ve been here a couple times and gotten a couple of the pasta dishes (Carbonara, Louisiana Chicken, Alfredo) and I&#39;ve never been disappointed. So it&#39;s safe to say that whatever you choose you should be pretty happy. <br><br>Now onto the Cheesecake. As you could guess by the name this is there pride and joy. They offer. HUGE selection of cheesecake as well. There is literally a flavor and style for everyone. I had to try the cookie dough the last time I went there. It was pretty good. The prices are also a decent size as well, which makes it better. I&#39;m pretty certain in the front of the place you can order yourself a whole cheesecake if you so choose so. <br><br>This place is great. I decided to give it 4 stars because they do everything great, but there wasn&#39;t anything that blew my socks off however. I feel like maybe if they took less items off the menu and focused on certain things it could be a better taste and experience overall. But with that being said. There isn&#39;t nothing bad to really complain about. This place perfectly balances quality and price. You feel like your getting what your paying for. If you have never been then it&#39;s a must try in Columbus.

We wanted to love our experience.  Our waiter was fantastic, our reservation was ready  to the exact minute, however the food was less than desirable.  We chose The Cheesecake Factory for our daughter&#39;s dinner to celebrate a weekend away for her 8th birthday.  She wanted an over the top dessert and we thought this would be perfect for her.  Our appetizer did not come out (although we were ultimately okay with this), our dinners took over 30 minutes for completion, and once done they were served one meal at a time over the course of minutes...  Our daughter wanted breakfast for dinner and was disappointed to received slightly undercooked eggs.  I followed suit with huevos rancheros that I quickly regretted.  The black beans were hard, SSU eggs were undercooked and slimy, and the tortillas were chewy.   On a high note, at least the Reese&#39;s cheesecake was delicious.  We&#39;ll opt for a Carryout cheesecake only in the event we decide to return.

So the Cheesecake Factory usually is a guaranteed great option. However the food was not that great this time. I ordered the cauliflower and it was just okay. however I think they gave me what was at the bottom of the pan because it was mostly crumbs of cauliflower and I found a French fry in my food. I&#39;m Thankful that it was not something else lol. Also I ordered a veggie burger and it came out cold and it had a huge past noodle stuck on the bottom. Again I&#39;m thankful it was not something worse but it was another disappointment. The waiter did apologize and brought me out another one that was hot but it was not a good veggie burger. The only positive experience was the waiter. She was very nice and attentive. I give her personally a 5 star! But the experience as a whole was a 3
Cheesecake factory is one my favorite places to dine. The cheesecake is delicious. I traditionally eat the oreo, but I recently tried the Hershey&#39;s chocolate and it was amazing!

Crazy busy place - but it was an AMAZING meal!  We thought going at 5 pm would beat the crowd - but we were wrong.  Not sure if there were lots out for dinner before a movie or eating after early holiday shopping - or perhaps off school/work for Veterans Day (on a Friday).  Regardless, we think they said it would be a 10 minute wait - and it was eleven.  Not bad, but lobby was crowded as it was SO COLD out that night.<br><br>We got a nice 2-seater table away for any window - good so we could warm up.  Our waitress was super nice and attentive.  Overall, they did a good job keeping our drinks filled (we got a different waitress half way through our time there - weird.)  <br><br>Hubby ordered the chicken chipotle pasta dish.  He had ordered it before and remembered it being good.  This meal lived up to his recollection and was very good (EMPTY PLATER).<br><br>I ordered the Skinnylicious chopped chicken salad dish - dressing on the side.  I think I got what I ordered (no dressing - ever.  but it was fine without).  I question whether it was actually a Skinnylicious under 590 calorie dish as it was SO GOOD.  There was plenty of flavorful bacon and crumbled bleu cheese, as well as chicken, avocado and corn.  It was a huge serving.  I just have trouble believing it was Skinnylicious.  Regardless, I ate EVERY SINGLE BITE OF IT!  I posted a photo - check it out.  You can see al the cheese and the pile of shredded greens.<br><br>The only very  minor complaint (although it&#39;s more of a strong comment) - was the food seemed to take a while to come out.  Granted we had fresh bread to snack on - so we weren&#39;t dying of hunger.  Also, we really weren&#39;t in a hurry to go back out in the cold to trek back to the garage for our car.<br><br>I have to remember how much I love the salad so we return more often.

Don&#39;t order the NY strip! It&#39;s a very thin portion (definitely not worth the price). When we received  our steaks, they were over cooked (actually charred). Our sides of broccoli were dry and not tasty. We planned out a nice lunch and left extremely disappointed.<br><br>(Responding to Guest Service)<br><br>We did speak to a manager who was less than helpful. FYI, tell your manager(s) not to kneel on the floor when speaking to a customer. It&#39;s very unprofessional. You must have recruited her from the Waffle House. Anyway, Please consider removing the (thin) NY strip from your menu. When you think of the Cheese Steak Factory, you think of a meal that is grandiose. In fact, people use to brag about the abundance of food that you use to serve. Your NY Strip is a huge disappointment. Even your manager states that it was a hard steak to cook because it is too thin

Terrible service!   Server messed up order and left one plate out for extended time while waiting for the correct food for the other party   Food was then cold No attempt to compensate for  poor experience.   Poor management at this location!

One of the things I love about the Cheesecake Factory is that the options are plentiful, both for the meals and the cheesecake! Unfortunately, I think that&#39;s also the drawback. It seems the menu is so big things can&#39;t really be executed well, which is to be expected, but the price and the product don&#39;t match in my opinion. <br><br>My friend and I came here last night because I had a $50 gift card and we thought we&#39;d be pretty set! Unfortunately, the meal was both much more expensive, and much more underwhelming than anticipated. <br><br>I started with the loaded tots appetizer which was delicious! Highly recommend! I also had a blood orange margarita which was just okay, and for $11.50 I expected much better! <br><br>For dinner I had the bang bang chicken and shrimp which was just under $20 and was also just okay. The description said it was a spicy dish which is what sold me, but on a scale of 1-10 of spicy I&#39;d say it was a 1. I&#39;m not sure if they just forgot to put it in, but the whole meal was pretty bland. In addition, the serving size was huge! I took home way more than I ate and 3 people could have easily filled up with this one plate of food. While It&#39;s nice to get your &#34;bang for your buck&#34; in portions, I would have preferred the bang to come from the quality of the meal. I&#39;d be much more inclined to pay more for good food than pay more for a lot of bad food. <br><br>I&#39;m also still pretty unsure what the ambiance is all about. The chairs are really small and uncomfortable, the tables are really close together and awkward, and the lights are so dimmed the old woman next to us was using her phone light to read the menu! <br><br>On a brighter note, the Cheesecake was delicious and the service was great! If I ever come back (which I would only do if given another gift card) I would stick with appetizers and cheesecake! All of my favorite things have always been the small plates/appetizers and they&#39;re also much more affordable!

The front desk person had a attitude then we got seated in the corner and didn&#39;t even get served at all. Waited for a whole 20 minutes then re ask to be seated somewhere else waited 10 more minutes to get re seated. The seated person was rude then re waited another 20 minutes to get served finally. The food was very cold and took a long time to for it to come. BAD SERVICE very disappointed I wanted to spend a lot cause me and my friend was craving it.
1 star because it can&#39;t be zero. Must be a poorly managed location because employ engagement is horrible. If this wasn&#39;t part of a popular shopping location I&#39;m sure business would fail.
I had the best filet mignon, good service,  5/5 stars I would recommend this place.  Everything was great.

Danny the server is amazing! He served my husband and I with a smile and we never had to wait for our drinks. Danny also made good conversation with us &amp; he looked like he was having a good time! We will definitely be back!
Always amazing food. Make a reservation or be prepared to wait forever. Service is great too. Above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed
Service is okay but food prep has gone way downhill lately, my food came out wrong twice. It&#39;s always crowded so there&#39;s no real incentive for them to improve.
Chris, our server was phenomenal. The greatest guy and really made my birthday one to remember. He was so sweet and fun to talk to! Also so kind and overall a great server. 10/10.

Whenever I think of The Cheesecake Factory I picture Oprah Winfrey singing lyrics to Drake&#39;s song Childplay (&#34;This is a place for families that drive Camries and go to Disney&#34;) while slicing pieces of cheesecake for her guests. I have no clue why I picture this in my head, but it does sorta set a stage for what I expect when I plan to visit. It&#39;s a very family friendly establishment, it can be rather lavish, and it&#39;s pretty much what folks are deeming &#34;basic&#34; these days.  Now basic isn&#39;t necessarily a bad thing. To me is just means, common or popular. <br><br>This specific location of The Cheesecake Factory is right in the middle of Easton shopping center. This means there&#39;s a lot of parking surrounding it but depends on the time of year, day, etc. you may have to walk a bit. When you&#39;re walking in to give your name to the host, you&#39;ll notice a great patio! I always choose to sit outside if the weather is nice. This spot also has a good sized bar and an enormous dining area. It honestly feels never ending. This is a good thing considering how busy this location is. It always seems like there&#39;s a line out the door however I never seem to have to wait very long before I&#39;m being taken back to a table. <br><br>I feel like the last several times I&#39;ve visited I&#39;ve gotten the same waitress. She is a total sweetheart and has definitely been working there for a while. She&#39;s always quick to greet the table, take drink orders, bring out bread, and she regularly checks in to make sure everything is going well. Speaking of bread, I love that they always bring out warm, freshly baked bread. Usually sourdough and honey wheat, both fantastic, especially when you&#39;re starving! I don&#39;t have a go-to menu item when I visit. I tend to try something new each time. I can confidently say that the Almond Crusted Salmon Salad is delicious! Big thumbs up! It comes tossed in a light lemon vinaigrette and it&#39;s very refreshing! I also enjoy the Greek salad on the small plate menu, the avocado eggrolls on the appetizer menu, and the pastas are tasty and filling (the portions feel huge). Now, when it comes to down the actual cheesecake, I could go on and on forever. Every single one I&#39;ve had has been amazing. The white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake is absolutely heavenly. I take a bite and it&#39;s pretty close to an outta body experience - no lie. The white chocolate macadamia nut is also a top choice. I love the crunch of the nuts. It gives it some much-needed texture. <br><br>Overall, I guess what I&#39;m trying to say is the food and the service has always been pretty good here. Its consistent and consistent is nice and comforting. It&#39;s why people visit the same restaurants over and over again. That&#39;s likely why I keep coming back to The Cheesecake Factory when I&#39;m hungry and it&#39;s near by. While the majority of the time I dine out, I go local, I can make an exception to that rule every now and then.

As usual, this Easton location is always superb.  Every dining experience, I leave happier than I came in  Food , drinks , service     The waiting to get seats are a challenge, BUT that is typical though.  TCF- 100%
We came for cheesecake for dinner and they delivered. It was very good. My son was happy with his grilled cheese.

It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory, they have a lot of things and they do them pretty well. <br><br>This herb crusted salmon is one of the smaller portions, but isn&#39;t too pricey for being seafood. The salmon is always moist and this sauce is delicious on the potatoes as well. <br><br>Cheesecake is always on point as well.

Stopped in Sunday afternoon about 1:00.  This place is busy!  We put our name down and waited about 30 min for our pager to buzz.  We were seated and promptly attended to.  Our drink order was taken and some time was given to review the 30 page menu.  The menu is overwhelming but if you break it down and go directly for the pages that are of interest then you only have about 2-4 pages to look at.  It&#39;s even easier if you decided between dinner or sandwiches.  We chose sandwiches, and the sandwiches that we chose were delicious.  We have eaten here before and had items off the dinner menu.<br> <br>The Cheesecake Factory is pretty expensive but the quality of the meal is worth the price that you pay. The sandwiches are around $14 and the meals are around $20.<br> <br>Our server was fun and attentive. He brought out our drinks and fresh bread. We placed our order, and our sandwiches were brought out in a good amount of time.<br> <br>Our service was great, and the food was fabulous.  We shared a  1/2 sandwich with each other so we could try them both out, but we only ended up eating  1/2 of our own sandwich as we were full.  We both enjoyed our sandwiches and French fries and mentioned how tasty and fresh the ingredients were and the crispiness of the French fries.<br> <br>We did not order any dessert this time but have in the past.  The cheesecake is fantastic and I highly recommend ordering a piece. <br> <br>Order:<br> <br>CUBAN SANDWICH $13.95<br>Slow Roasted Pork, Ham, Swiss cheese, Pickles, Mustard and Mayonnaise on a Grilled and Pressed Roll. Served with French Fries or Green Salad.<br> <br>CHICKEN PARMESAN SANDWICH $13.95<br>Tender Chicken Lightly Coated in Parmesan Breadcrumbs, Roasted Peppers, Tomato Sauce and Melted Cheese on a Freshly Grilled French Roll. Served with French Fries or Green Salad.

One of my favorite restaurants and I&#39;m glad I only came in to get a to go desert. <br>When I entered, three people st the hostess stand watched me enter without greeting. Thought that was awkward so I went to the cheesecake display and there was a guy who didn&#39;t greet me either. I had to start the conversation. <br>Not sure if it was because it was Monday or maybe they didn&#39;t like my coat but it was a turn off. When I got rang up, he did so but when I paid with a card, he gave me my item (as he was talking to someone else), then had me sign giving me my card last. Just an awkward 10 minutes spent and for this, I&#39;d rather use an app next time. <br>I&#39;m not a local and was in town for work. The key lime was the only sweet taste I had of this place.

We go to Cheesecake Factories across the country because they are usually consistent in food as well as service. This was not the case with our visit to this location. My husband and I sat at the bar for brunch on a Sunday. Our service was outstanding; as were the Bloody Mary&#39;s we enjoyed. That is where the enjoyment ended. We both ordered the Farm Fresh Eggs over easy. My husbands eggs were cooked correctly but my eggs were quite undercooked (egg whites where still runny).  The bacon was cold and overcooked, like it had been cooked earlier and put in a holding bin waiting to be ordered. I don&#39;t know about you but bacon is sacred food and should be treated as such! The potatoes weren&#39;t bad (crunchy) but lacked any character. The toast was thin and overcooked, which did little for sopping eggs. Overall, not worth the money.

I&#39;m not one to complain, but this is the 3rd time I have came here for cheesecake and every time something goes wrong. The first time I ordered three slices of cheesecake the weren&#39;t ready when the pickup time said they were going to be. Then they claimed I never ordered online, but I had the online order receipt. The second time we ordered food and cheesecake the food was cold and the order was wrong. The last time was on my birthday on the 26th, I had a gift card that had $10.25 left on in so my mom went in to get the two slices. When she paid the cashier said it was $6.00 left to pay she paid with my card. I happen to look at my bank statement it shows $16 on it. I&#39;m not sure what happened he either gave himself a $10 tip without my permission. I would never tell anyone to go to this location. This is crazy.
Love the chicken Madeira at Cheesecake Factory   My favorite always. Great service for Valentines Day. Eating at the bar with the wait. Still wonderful.   Recommend at Eaton.

I had a 4:00 reservation and once there I found out they were running behind. We were finally called back at  5:10. As we walked back to our table the waitress looked flustered and our table was still full of the last patrons stuff still.   So we had to go back up front and wait another 7 minutes. When we got to our table our drinks came out immediately but the bread was hard as a rock. Then we had to hunt our waiter down to place our order. Which was placed at 6:25   The appetizer was nasty. We had nachos and they were burnt. I sent my salad back because I asked for one dressing and got another on it. When the food came out they brought it out one person meal every 5 minutes. So we all got our food separately/ it was  6 of us. Then everything was cold but my chicken salad was warm. We ended up getting full on the lemonade. This was my sons birthday and it was ruined I complained to the manager but he was no help

As usual, the atmosphere loud but it was okay for Friday night. We ordered Cajun jambalaya pasta and Truffle-honey chicken. Pasta was good but the chicken was little bit sweet and oily in my taste, breading was soggy and oil dripping from the chicken. The service was exceptional. As usual, the atmosphere loud but it was okay for Friday night.  3.5 stars.

The food are delicious but very expensive. Last time I was here with my friends, we waited for 20 min for a server to come get our orders because we &#34; sat&#34; in the section with no servers. Yeah sure, you guys directed us to that section and now telling us there were no servers there. I would not recommend this place due to long time and how inattentive the staff are

The menu is quite large. I usually stick my same buffalo blast or chicken samosas for an appetizer. Then I follow with the Jumbo shrimp angel hair pasta dish. But today I tried Chicken Marsala. The sauce was watery and the chicken had no flavor. Decent wine. Great customer service!!

This is the worst experience i&#39;ve had at a cheesecake factory so far. First we get seated, with our party of 8. We all expect it to take a while since we have a rather large party. We get seated at 6:42 and order at 7:01. Our food takes an hour to arrive which angers us all. The food comes out and it&#39;s good quality. We wait 20 more minutes for our desert. We pay and then the server LOSES MY CHECK and charges me $1. Worst service i&#39;ve ever had.

I haven&#39;t been here in probably 10 years. Located in the heart of Easton Towne Center. Parking at parking lots located on both sides or street parking with meters.<br>Casual ambience. Warning.. it&#39;s very dark in the restaurant. Guess it&#39;s supposed to help create the mood but i wear super thick glasses and it made me feel blind.<br>They give you bread before the meal, i would have thought it would come out warm but it didnt. Was very hard to spread the butter. I did appreciate the honey wheat bread though.<br>Food didnt take too long. Our waiter was good and gave us a wide range of selections of his preferences. I ordered a chicken dish that was breaded chicken in a lemon sauce with sides of mashed potatoes and asparagus..the chicken was really good.<br>The dish was only $17ish and it was so much food, made it into two meals...lunch for the next day. <br>The menu has a wide variety from seafood, to chicken, to pastas, to steaks and sandwiches. They also offer a skinny meal with a pretty good selection with minimized calories.<br>Looking forward to a return visit to try something else. Not sure why it&#39;s taken me 10 years to return!
Yesterday was my first time going there!!! Cheesecake was amazing and the service we received from Trae was phenomenal!!! He was super nice and personable

Nice atmosphere food wasn&#39;t warm but the server was very apologetic told her things happened out of our control. Manager made up by offering complimentary cheesecake. Made worth coming back! Thank you management

Right across from the Hilton in Easton and open til 1230 am! Made for a perfect stop after the Taylor Swift concert to get ourselves a piece of cheesecake to go and share. The lemon meringue cheesecake is one of our absolute favorites...the sweetness of cheesecake but with a fantastic tang of lemon. Topped with a toasted meringue, whipped cream and candied lemon peels. Try it, it is such a great cheesecake, especially after you&#39;ve had a filling meal.
This place has nice atmosphere and great dessert. The cake was too big for us, I guess . Spicy chicken chipotle pasta was the point for our whole meal with tasty spicy sauce.

I&#39;ve been to this location a few times before for lunch and dinner. This time I went for brunch with 4 other people. We all got something different and I got the eggs Benedict with the potatoes and a side of fruit. Pretty standard. <br><br>We ordered coffee and I also asked for a water. I didn&#39;t get the water until I asked 2 more times toward the end of the meal. I had to ask twice for sweetener. This was frustrating because it took our server a long time to come back. <br><br>My food arrived before everyone else&#39;s by several minutes. Each persons dish arrived a few minutes after the next, except the breakfast combo. That came about 5 minutes after the 4th meal arrived. A waffle, two scrambled eggs and bacon was the last to arrive. At least it was hot when it came. So if you plan to eat together, good luck because not everyone will get their food together. <br><br>My meal was pretty good. Still warm by the time we all had our food. It was pretty standard Benedict. Nothing to write home about. <br><br>One friend got the eggs, toast and bacon and they forgot the bacon. The friend with the waffle had to send it back because it was borderline over cooked. Another friend got the brioche breakfast sandwich and the last friend got the monte cristo. Both sandwiches looked sloppy and haphazard. The monte cristo was not a typical monte cristo, not what you normally would think of and she wasn&#39;t pleased with it. <br><br>$3.25 for standard drip coffee and a breakfast I can get at the corner spot in a suburb would have been better. You&#39;re definitely paying for the name when you come here. I prefer Cheesecake Factory for dinner.

No reservations...on the weekend. Miss Anthony Bourdain! We got there 4:45 for date nite and waited 30 minutes for a table on a Saturday. Not bad. Try the bourbon and honey martini. Very good. Ordered warm crab and artichoke dip. Yum! Hubby ordered NY strip steak. i ordered shrimp and pasta. His was very good. Mine not so much. Bland. Asked for more sauce  hoping that would help. Nope. Decided to have boxed so i could fix it up at home. Waiter who took forever to check our table finally came by, took my food to box it up. We ordered lemon meringue cheesecake to take home also. Waited. Waited. Asked where my food was and from the look on the waiter&#39;s face, it was not happening as he figured he had inadvertently thrown it out!  Said he would rush a re order and give me both cheesecake and food at same time. Well we waited and waited. Got bill but no food. Waited. I then spoke to Bryan. I believe he was the manager. We werent gonna make the movie but he got my food together right away and adjusted our bill. Total wait time was approx 35 minutes.  Thank you Bryan. I know they were very busy and i understood that but i kept seeing other tables being taken care of in a timely manner. Fixed up my shrimp and pasta at home and it was tasty.  Oh well. Happy Merry Christmas!

We had a dinner for 7. <br><br>The pork belly sliders were very good. Too sweet but that seems to be what people want. Other than that, pretty much no one finished their meal and a lot of wasted food went in the garbage. Not great but better than most meals we&#39;ve had in Columbus. <br><br>An issue I would like to point out to management: The cookie cutter cutter interior planning that&#39;s used throughout the USA does not work in Columbus. There simply is not enough room in the isles for 2 people to pass each other. Chairs stick way out into isles so people can fit. Even without that, what looks like a 4 foot wide isle may work elsewhere but it does not work here.
Service was okay but the food was served cold. Bread was so hard I couldn&#39;t eat it. Lost my appetite here but came in very hungry. Disappointed.

I ordered Cheesecake Factory thru the DoorDash app on Wednesday January 2, 2019. I spent 50.18 on my MasterCard. The Food actually got me sick an this is January 6,2019 and I&#39;m still not feeling any better!! I order the Shrimp &amp; Angel hair Pasta Meal and the Veggie Burger and Fries and my dining partner also made her sick as well.  <br><br>Today I&#39;m calling the Restaurant to speak with the manager I don&#39;t know what the handling situation was but I&#39;m NOT HAPPY AT ALL!! This happened at the Cheesecake Factory in Easton Towne Mall, Columbus Ohio.
definelty a 5 star thanks Legrace, my 1st time at this location and i honestly couldnt have asked for a better waiter. So nice,knowledgeable and fast. Thank You Legrace ohh and the food was great lol

The staff is a little disorganized or just rude. We walked in and waited several minutes for the hostess to arrive. None of the staff acknowledged us. We then went to the bar area. The bartender was condescending when we asked how we would be seated. If you do not want to be in the hospitality business, then you should look for employment elsewhere. Our server, Antoinette, was the  only reason I gave this place 3-stars. She was an excellent server: Very kind, attentive, and professional.

Our family visits a few times per month. Normally give 4 star, but only 2 or 3 star today. Not fresh salad, found something weird meat in our chicken pasta, which weird meat is definately not chicken... Even pasta is not warm, the temperature is like room temperature food.

Been to the cheesecake factory several times and it seems to be going on a downhill slope tonight I had the fried shrimp platter which I&#39;ve had better out of box out of the deep freezer then for dessert I had cheesecake their original vanilla cheesecake that I have had better no bake cheesecake&#39;s and what was served to me today our total bill was well over $100 and I don&#39;t think the whole entire check should&#39;ve been more than $20 for what I tried because it tasted like prepackage BS

The worst service I have ever received. They told us it was a half hour wait... they kept telling us that the table was being cleaned for 30 minutes and then when we went up to ask them if the table was done being cleaned after 15 minutes they told us that &#34;no matter how many times we ask, the answer is going to be the same&#34;. We then waited another 30 minutes for our table and we were so hungry that one person from our group had to Uber to a different restaurant. Our other friend was hyper glycemic and kept requesting food so she wouldn&#39;t pass out. Our 9 party group was so hungry as we ordered our food after AN HOUR AND A HALF, that we got full after eating the complimentary bread and didn&#39;t get to eat our dinners. Terrible experience.

This place was awful. The only good thing was the waiter. The noodles weren&#39;t cooked all the way. The chicken tenders were brought out after everything else was eaten. The burger wasn&#39;t cooked to standards. The waiting service was horrible, the hostess wasn&#39;t very <br><br>I will say our waiter tried his best to make sure we left as happy as he could.  It was by no means his fault to the point I felt bad for him. Thank you for your response.

Since I had a GC, a friend and I decided to eat here. It was pretty busy When we got here, on a Thursday evening at 7 pm, but we got seated right away (simply because we were a party of two). Our waitress was pleasant. <br><br>Thoughts on the food? This was not my first Time to CCF. And, in fact, after eating the cheesecake when I got home, it seemed lacking compared to my last piece of cc from here. In fact, I wasn&#39;t pleased with the tiramisu taste this time. Change of recipe? Or have my tastebuds changed over the 2 years. And for the $5.95 price, I&#39;m inclined to say I like the Kroger cake better. Yes, you heard me. Unfortunately, this leaves me rather bummed. All the talk and hype, and my tongue didn&#39;t get that experience. <br><br>Backing up, I got Chicken Carbonara for the main course. Tender chicken cubes. Creamy garlic-cheese sauce. A good amount of bacon bits. Not bad. $18 good? Don&#39;t know if I&#39;d go that far. <br><br>I&#39;m not sure I&#39;ll be back, unless of course, family decides to meet for a meal. The prices are, I feel, too high. Perhaps they feel it&#39;s warrant, since Easton&#39;s clientele has more income to burn. Who knows. I&#39;m inclined toward the local, mom and pop places, that you know every penny is put back into the establishment, and food!!

Now, come on, I know I&#39;ve reviewed this.  We go here every few months.  It&#39;s another of Sweetie&#39;s favorites that I am glad to go to, but not at the top of my list.<br><br>Huge, always busy, always loud.  But, good food, huge slices of an endless variety of cheesecakes, and good service.  This time we just stopped in for cheesecake.  So busy that literally getting us two slices took 10 minutes.  Rich, huge slices, in pretty much any flavor you can think of.<br><br>When we come for dinner, Sweetie usually gets a steak and salmon combo, and loves it.  I get something spicy- shrimp, jambalaya, etc.  Always good, and plenty for leftovers.  It is expensive, but the quality and quantity make that worth it.  We&#39;ll see how things go with a baby for dining in sometime soon.  <br><br>Try to come at off hours (still busy, just not crazy.)  Prepare to wait, regardless.  Pick something from the huge menu.  And have some cheesecake, to go.

Today we made another trip into Columbus and decided to give Cheesecake Factory another shot after their response from the manager or whomever it was.  We decided to go about 2:30,  there was no wait and to be quite honest about it the waiter we got seemed a little cocky maybe even arrogant but didn&#39;t do a bad job.   Other than that stale ass bread he brought out. Not stale just hard as a rock with freezing cold butter what the hell is someone supposed to do with that?  I got the bone-in New York strip and it was a damn good steak.  It had a great flavor cooked perfectly which is pretty rare anymore but this one was in fact cooked perfect it was a little small for the price it was roughly $20 and it couldn&#39;t have been an 8 to 10 oz steak.  My wife got the fish and chips should have been called chips and fish maybe even again fish sticks she&#39;s one of those weird people that don&#39;t like tartar sauce so she has buffalo sauce on her fish.   She said the buffalo sauce was good but really hot which I always thought that was a good thing for her the hotter the better I had a piece of cheesecake since our gift cards were running low this will probably be the last time that we went so I wanted to try a piece of cheesecake to see how it stacked up against hers They have some work to do because hers is so much better and believe it or not she&#39;s not even in the room to hear this, wow that sucks.

Had very good service on this trip. My wife had meat loaf and I had the fresh grilled salmon. My wife liked her meat loaf and my salmon was good as well but not amazing. <br><br>Salmon needed some additional seasoning in my opinion. The wife and I also got some cheesecake slices. I got the original and she had the tuxedo. Both of these were excellent.

Food was amazing, service was great. Only complaint with how loud it is, the music is too high, it&#39;s hard to have a conversation. The menu is also absolutely HUGE, they have every option available. I mentioned to the waiter about the loud music, he agreed, yet nothing was done.

This poor girl has been on a &#34;healthy-living journey&#34; for a year and a half now (I&#39;ve lost 200 pounds!) so when my birthday rolled around this year, I wanted to be REAL bad. So of course I picked the Cheesecake Factory, America&#39;s biggest guilty pleasure. <br><br>We went on a Friday at about 2:00pm since this location gets crazy packed on Saturday and Sunday and we quickly got a table for 2. Since I knew I was going to eat a slice of cheesecake with an entire days worth of calories and fat grams, we decided to order the chicken samosas appetizer from the Skinnylicious menu. They were amazing! Full of spiced meat and lightly fried but not dripping in grease. The dipping sauce was great too, so we were very pleased with this low-calorie app. <br><br>For my meal I ordered the sausage &amp; ricotta flatbread also from the Skinnylicious menu, and my husband had the Cuban sandwich. When they delivered our meals I&#39;m not gonna lie: I was totally jealous of the huge, crusty sandwich my husband received. It looked so unbelievably good! He said it was delicious even though he prefers softer bread (I like it firm and crusty so this looked perfect to me). My flatbread was listed as a small plate and it definitely was small, but it was pretty awesome. The sausage was finely ground and tasted great and the ricotta and kale combo was so tasty. A small dish that packed a ton of flavor, so I was a happy girl.<br><br>Now, the REAL reason we visited this place...the cheesecake. I had the Oreo dream extreme (covered in thick chocolate and full of soft Oreo bits - EXACTLY what I was craving!) and my husband had the vanilla bean (sounded boring but tasted like the most delicious, whippy scoop of vanilla bean ice cream ever). Both slices were huge and literally too good to put into words. <br><br>Overall, this Cheesecake Factory visit made this an awesomely delicious birthday!

No matter the wait at Cheesecake Factory, you can always get in, in a decent amount of time. I love the variety of items on the menu! Several gluten-free options and every server that I&#39;ve ever had at this establishment is very informed with this. I LOVE the Sweet Corn Tamales and the Four Cheese Pasta. I feel like they have always have something for everyone. I wish they took reservations. But I love the Cheesecake Factory. Craving it right now actually.

Really meh overall. I haven&#39;t been in a Cheesecake Factory in quite sometime and this experience reminded me why. Came in on a busy Saturday and the place was relatively full. Despite this, we were seated quite quickly. That was the only quick thing. Our server was a kind stressed out lady who spent most of her time rushing around and apologizing constantly as everything even drinks were taking an abnormally long time (even for a busy Saturday) In addition there was a massive hold up in the bakery and people were waiting quite some time for coffee drinks, hot chocolate and cheesecake. Apparently the printer ran out of ink and when it was replaced the backed up orders came rushing in. Unfortunate issue, but honestly seemed like a problem that better planning could have circumvented. When our food did make it to us, my partner was not satisfied with his dish and had it sent back (mine was decent! no complaints there). The manager came out and apologized, which was nice and urged him to try something else. In the end he settled on an appetizer portion of chips and guacamole, which was good. The lemon raspberry cheesecake I got at the end of the meal was also good. But overall the experience was rather disappointing. The manager didnt even to bother to offer comping the replacement appetizer,(the only real reason he got something else is because the manager suggested it) and the dining time took way way longer than anticipated even for a Saturday night. No thanks.

Things started out great; nice evening seated in less than 10 minutes, unfortunately that is where the great experience ended. We waited for 55 minutes for the food and then only half was delivered - with the 2nd half arriving 9 minutes later.  Not a great experience. In terms of the food itself. Chicken avocado club and Tuscan chicken were good, with the latter being Luke warm. The Mexican letus wrap = flavorless, cold and 80% cabbage. Vegie burger = poor. My family had to leave so I settled the bill, as I did the table was bussed while I still sat there. I informed the manager about the experience,  he responded with a 23% discounted bill. Won&#39;t be back for anything other than an occasional dessert.

Our food and service was wonderful! Christian was our server and he did a great job making sure our drinks were always full and that we were enjoying ourselves! He always had a smile on his face and was polite to all of the tables around us as well! Christian and the cooks deserve 5 stars for sure! <br><br>I gave 4 stars because we were told a 30 minute wait and waited for an hour. I understand they can&#39;t give you an exact quote of how long it will be but 5 or 6 two tops were seated before us that came in well over 20 minutes AFTER we did. When we asked the hostess about it they sat us within 5 minutes. Need more training up front for sure!

I&#39;ve always been a fan and probably always will be. I hate waiting to be seated at restaurants and this one is one of the worst. It&#39;s so hard to get into 75% of the time. <br><br>Their menu is massive. Like ginormous. I&#39;ve tried several things on the menu, but my go to is always the pasta davinci. The portions are rather large and a to go box is usually necessary. Their appetizers are all good too. Most recently tried the Nashville hot chicken bites and enjoyed those. <br><br>I love that ordering dessert here is the norm and is expected. I don&#39;t feel like others are judging me as much for being a pig at this restaurant. Sometimes my hubs and l will get a piece of cheesecake for the table and a piece to go for the next day. Everything I&#39;ve had here has been solid and the service is always okay. Nothing exceptional, but not bad.

ANGIE IS THE BEST WAITRESS EVER! I had the best service ever (by any restaurant) by Angie. I&#39;m from LA and visited this location with my mother and grandmother and Angie was absolutely AMAZING!! I can&#39;t say enough positive things about her! She made the whole experience SO enjoyable!

Last Sunday I met my best friend for brunch.. Another friend had mentioned for me to get the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes; that they were the best she ever had.. So sure enough we both ordered Large Iced Coffees and split the pancakes. She also ordered the Chicken and Waffles which we both enjoyed.. Everything was great.. service and quality of food.. We will definitely be back soon...

I always have an enjoyable experience coming to The Cheesecake Factory. This most recent visit was no exception, I had a great time. I came with a group of about 10. Our service was great, our server kept our drinks coming and made sure our food was out quickly. Every interaction we had with our server was exciting, she engaged with us and made exciting conversation. The food was prepared to perfection. For anyone who has never been to The Cheesecake Factory, warning it is pricey. Chips and quac are $15 for example, but the serving is a substantial size. We got to-go cheesecake at the front of the restaurant. It&#39;s an efficient system- there&#39;s a roped off line and a counter for anyone who walks in for take out or for those leaving the restaurant wanting a to-go. I would recommend eating here on a date night, the atmosphere is relaxed and somewhat fancy.

When we made our reservation (party of 2) we were told that it would be a 45 minute wait for outside and 15-20 minute wait for a table inside. There were about 5 people who were seated outside before us and we went to tell the waitress, she told us that it was first come, first serve outside (but that was never relayed to us). At this point, it had been 40 minutes of us waiting. We said we&#39;ll take either inside or outside. A couple was seated outside after we were told we would be next. I have never had such a horrible experience before at this cheesecake factory.

Worst service I think ever !! I&#39;m a server myself and I just cannot believe how rude the server was. She forgot about our food so it came out cold. She never once asked how everything was. Our mashed potatoes were hard as a rock and she saw us touching them so she actually did bring us new warm and not hard potatoes. But didn&#39;t ask about the rest of the food. I feel like she was pre-judging us but I came in with $350 in cash to spend because it was my friends birthday. My friends steak (rare) came out over cooked and the manager was asking if it needed cooked longer !? I had to explain that &#34;no&#34; being rare... she wants it bloody. My salmon and steak were cold and neither one of our meals came with a steak knife. Plus the food did not come out all at once. Being a server I can understand. But, during that whole meal she never once asked us how everything was. At the very end of the meal she made a rude comment as us how we knew each other. She hadn&#39;t talked to us all night and it just seemed like a bizzar question to ask. I hated my salmon and nobody wants cold food.
Service was perfect ......server was really on point.  Salmon was good ....food came pretty fast

The food I had was really good. My table mates though found strange hairs and other substances in their food that didn&#39;t belong. It also takes a really long time to get food and they use straws. I will not be coming back and don&#39;t recommend.

We had a friend who really wanted to have her birthday dinner at the Cheesecake Factory. So against our better judgement, we signed up for a large group dinner at a restaurant that doesn&#39;t accept reservations.<br><br>Knowing that there will be a wait, we arrived well ahead of the group at 4:30 to put our name in for our 12-person table.<br><br>We were advised that a large group had just sat down at 4:30 so that it will be a 2 hour wait. Apparently they designate one specific set of seats at this restaurant for large groups, so we had the wait for the group before us to leave.  Never mind that this is a huge restaurant and could have placed us elsewhere if they&#39;d actually tried. We literally saw over a 100 people seated before us after all.<br><br>Unfortunately for us, the large group that they allowed to seat before us at the only table we were allowed to sit at was not a complete party, and it apparently took them an hour to even order since not everyone had arrived when they seated this group ahead of us. <br><br>So we waited and waited and waited. For 3 hours in the end. It could&#39;ve been 2.5 hrs but they didn&#39;t want to hurry the group occupying our table apparently... Which is fair except the birthday girl went to check on our table and found 2 out of 12 table remaining, just texting on their phones. I know you don&#39;t kick people out of their seats at a restaurant usually, but come on!<br><br>The manager comped us some appetizers, which was nice of him. But 3 hours of my weekend to me is worth a little more than free nachos and chicken tenders. <br><br>And the final zinger? The birthday girl ordered a veggie burger and they were out. Sigh...
Recommend the Mac &amp; Cheese bites and the fish Tacos , my waitress was super nice and attentive , EVEN PACKED MY LEFT OVERS, it is very crowded but I mean it THEE CHEESCAKE FACTORY,

I decided to stop in for dinner and eat on the patio since it was a nice sunny day out. The patio is real nice, but to me i think the servers had to many tables which slowed down the service. <br><br>My wife and I started off with drinks she had the strawberry Martini i had the red Sangria it took longer than usual to just get two drinks this was not at a peak time it was before the 6pm dinner crowd. I ordered a side salad i say about 20 mins had past no salad the next thing i know here comes our food never brought out my salad. The food was delicious and our server was nice.<br><br>The bill came and my wife and I was shocked on how much our drinks cost her Martini was 11.95 and my Sangria was 10.95 let me say this the drinks are way to expensive and not worth it. The drinks are to pricey, so beware before you order a drink.

We love The Cheesecake Factory and it&#39;s our go-to <br>place with our kids.  The menu is vast and servings are large.  This past visit we went on a rainy Saturday night.  Wait was typical to be seated. Our wit for bread was 40 minutes.  With 4 very hungry kids that was ridiculous.  Our server said he would bring it in 2-3 minutes after ordering.  I finally went by the kitchen to ask for crackers and the server said they didn&#39;t have crackers, but she would get me some bread!  So very frustrating for something patrons expect quickly at this restaurant.  <br>The restaurant has great food and amazing cheesecake but I don&#39;t recommend going at busy times.

Try the Jamaican shrimp<br><br>I always like Caribbean food and they did a nice job with it. I&#39;m not a big fan of national chains like this but always enjoy the food if it&#39;s prepared to the quality that they execute. Service was also very good and we barely had to wait for anything. <br><br>At the end of the meal our table ordered three pieces of Cheesecake to try out which was the best. The red velvet won for our table against the tiramasu and some other chocolatey chocolate cake. <br><br>I&#39;d recommend the place if your in a bind for a food place to try.

I never been to a cheesecake factory in my entire life. I always wanted to go. I love cheesecake, my favorite is strawberry cheesecake. I haven&#39;t tried the other kinds yet. I want to try and experience new restaraunts and they foods. I&#39;m hoping I can go to the cheesecake factory one day.

Let me just preface by saying that my husband and I came here a few months ago and had an awful experience. Our waiter forgot to put our appetizer in, and it took a long time to get our food (like over an hour and a half long)<br><br>Today, we had family come in to town that really wanted to come to the Cheesecake Factory to eat. I called and they said the wait would be an hour and a half. We rushed over and there was literally no waiting. The hostess said they would seat us in a few minutes. We put our name in. There was a big rush of people that came in after and all of which were continuously getting seated before we did. I understand maybe couples and small parties, but there were 6 of us and I heard two other parties of six being called before us. I had to check on it twice before they seated us. Overall we probably waited 30 minutes.<br><br> It took us a while to get settled and place our order. We had people all around us getting orders that had been seated after us. Our waiter came by about an hour in and said, &#34;we&#39;re just waiting on three plates, it will be out soon&#34;. 25 more minutes go by and we see people leaving that we saw walk in after us. Our waiter stops by again and says, &#34;we&#39;re waiting on one more plate, it&#39;ll be out soon&#34;. I get that he is trying to communicate, but you are basically telling us the first plate has been sitting there for AT LEAST 25 minutes. This is not something you should tell people. My dad asked for a manager and he came over after a long wait. We explained what was going on, and he apologized and said our food would be out shortly (keep in mind, we had already heard this TWICE). He said he would pull the plates out that we&#39;re done and once we all got our food he would come check on us. Most of the food was fine, but my husbands Mac and cheese was cold and his chicken was extremely hot like it had been microwaved. <br><br>To make matters worse, the manager never stopped back. I know it&#39;s insanely busy, but why I&#39;m the world would you even say that and not follow through? That was probably the most frustrating part. <br><br>I wish I could give this place 0 stars. One bad experience I will give you the benefit of the doubt, but two bad experiences and we&#39;re done. Id rather take my business to the million other restaurants in Easton.

I really enjoy this location...  they are open late, but due to their location - in the heart of Easton - they are ALWAYS busy!  It would be SO great if you were able to make a reservation.<br>I have been here several times, and it took a little while to find an entree that I loved.  There are several great appetizers, but again, I had a tough time with my entree... then I found it!  I love, LOVE the Hibachi steak.  The combined spices are phenomenal... They chef manages to get a nice, crisp outer edge while the meat is still tender and flavorful.<br>The Thai lettuce wraps are excellent, and large enough for an entree with left overs, or excellent to share as an appetizer<br>And of course, the cheesecake is awesome... two full pages!

We waited an hour for our food when the waiter brought out our kid&#39;s meal--grilled cheese. It was cold. The fruit looked like it was cut up a week ago or from a can.  The manager then came out asked what my brother-in-law got to eat because it hadn&#39;t came out in an hour and a half. Brother-in-law actually forgot because it had been so long since we ordered. The manager laughingly apologized and came back fifteen minutes later with his order--SLIDERS--an appetizer! We got cheesecake to go thinking it would be faster--nope. Another 25 minute wait. No manager to be found at this point to tell him about our disappointment. Nothing comped. First and last trip ever. Dinner food was OK. Staffed terribly. Cheesecake exceptional.

Amazing service and management! I called from out of state to ask them to send a cheesecake to my girlfriend&#39;s table who was eating there. They worked with me, decorated it, and sent it over with candles! Looked great - awesome team of people!

Nothing pleases me more than the abundance of portions not just with their cheesecake alone but their salad can be eaten for a dinner serving. The ambience is nice,always busy but the workers are always smiling and on point, food comes out hot hot hot and the cheesecake selection is to die for!!!

I love this place. The menu is huge so there is something for everyone...and everything I&#39;ve tried has been very good!  Definitely don&#39;t forget the cheesecake...oh my!!  The selection is expansive and they are all wonderful!!  You can order them to go if you are too full from your meal and they package them perfectly!!

I&#39;ve always loved cheesecake factory, especially their pasta dishes. My favorite is the shrimp bistro pasta (pictured). The shrimp is battered and fried, and the pasta is based with a buttery and delicious sauce. Definitely not for those who are trying to be healthy, but soooo worth the splurge. Although the pasta dishes are on the higher end in price ($16-$19), the portion is large and their complimentary bread makes it worth the trip.<br>Cheesecake factory is great for a large party, but the service is not quick. Every time I&#39;ve gone, the wait for food has often been 40 minutes after ordering. If you&#39;re a fan of cheesecake, then you should DEFINITELY try one of their selections. One slice is quite large, so you can split with someone and share the cost. But it&#39;s so good you might just want to eat it all or take it home.<br>I&#39;ve always loved my experiences here, and I would recommend this place to anyone!

Caveat - I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory twice before many years ago when I lived in a different state.  Was not impressed AT ALL then.  Because of that I never go there.  The only reason why I went there recently is because I wanted a salad for lunch &amp; I was trying to find places around where I work that had good salads.  A friend suggested the Cheesecake Factory, as large as their menu is, I knew they would probably have a salad that I may like.<br><br>Ordered the anti-oxidant salad, here is the description:  A Delicious Blend of Salad Greens, Spinach, Kale, Avocado, Broccoli, Grapes, Roasted Pear, Blueberries, Onion, Sunflower Seeds and Almonds with Lemon-Blueberry Vinaigrette.<br><br>Sounds appetizing right???  NOT.  This was basically a blend of salad greens.  I requested no avocado or almonds.  There were NO blueberries at all.  There were all of 8 grapes cut in half, the roasted pear was diced so tiny that as I was eating I remembered it was supposed to have pear and I had to dig for these miniscule pieces that basically added no flavor to all that kale and spinach.  There was also no broccoli in the salad!  The ONLY good thing was the dressing.  If I&#39;d wanted a kale &amp; spinach salad I would&#39;ve ordered that!  <br><br>Anyone whose ever been to the Cheesecake Factory knows they give large portion.  So I had this huge takeout of basically spinach &amp; kale with a few sunflower seeds, grapes &amp; diced pears with fabulous dressing.  Once AGAIN - I will not go to the cheesecake factory for the next 30 years.  Maybe they will improve by then.

This factory was crazy busy. Server was great, food was pretty good like usual.  Lettuce chicken wraps were a bit skimpy for price. 2 of the lettuces were almost too small to pick up. Taquitos were good but needed more filling.

We always eat here for business when in town, they have such a large menu everyone can find something they like. I had Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta, it was just ok. It&#39;s a pasta dish in olive oil and garlic with pine nuts and veggies. I get it every time not remembering that it doesn&#39;t have much flavor, they could stand to add more garlic and herbs, or even better vegan cheese! I had a pineapple vodka drink and it was amazing, I went back later and sat at the bar awhile just so I could have one.

Everything about our experience here was toeing the line of a disaster.<br><br>We were told it would be a 30-40 minute wait, but were then seated within 3 minutes. The host staff clearly have some work to do on estimating wait times. Though, I suppose it&#39;s better to under promise and then over deliver.<br><br>Our server seemed to think we needed the entire evening to read the menu since he made himself too scarce after taking our beverage order. He (or the kitchen?) managed to screw up almost order -- my brother&#39;s sweet potato fries &#34;fell off&#34; the plate on the way to the table and then they forgot to bring more; my salad came with the dressing on it instead of on the side; my nephew&#39;s hot fudge sundae showed up without hot fudge.<br><br>I know why people like this -- fake upscale with huge portions -- but I&#39;d skip it in favor of a local Columbus establishment any day.

I just don&#39;t really understand why chicken soft tacos need 45 minutes to be ready. And those tacos taste so bad.... <br>My server didn&#39;t check if I need refill at all through the whole process, in the end she just gave me one box for leftover instead of packing for me.

A.) Our app took 15 mins before they even came to tell us it wasn&#39;t available. <br>B.) A large piece of paper was found in my food (after I got it partially in my mouth). Management said, &#34;Sorry...&#34;  And took that item off our bill. Took my fries from me. Maybe the entire experience warranted a free meal. Good damage control would have made us return. We spend money and tip GREAT!<br>Both my boyfriend and I work in restaurants and are forgiving of mistakes, but not being dismissed. <br><br>Food was good enough that we might try Polaris CheeFact
