Very quick to get seated for two.   Noise level is higher than I prefer but tolerable.  I had a glass of wine and water within 10 minutes.   Very impressed.<br><br>Very dark, bring a flashlight if you have poor eyesight.<br><br>I orderes the Thai Glazed Salmon and it was absolutely wonderful.  So large a portion that I brought half my meal plus a slice of cheesecake home.<br><br>I would definitely recommend this location.  Just be prepared to walk after you find parking, wait a while to be seated and get cozy with the table next to you.

It had been years since I had eaten at a Cheesecake Factory, but my mom was in visiting and we needed a place that a wide variety of choices for all the picky eaters in my family, so we came here. I remember CF being a good place to eat for special occasions like birthdays and date nights. That still seems to be the case because the servers were performing off-key renditions of Happy Birthday about every 5 minutes. However, the quality of food and service was not what I remember. The food was bland and greasy. Our server seemed bored and was slow on food/drink delivery, despite the restaurant not being all that busy. The prices have gone up quite a bit, too, since the last time we ate here. <br>At least the cheesecake is still really good. Their mac &amp; cheese was super yummy too.<br>Overall, if you&#39;re at Easton and are craving dessert, stop on by, however, there are better, cheaper, non-chain restaurant options in Columbus to try.

Decision making: a skill that is elusive for some. Holiday weekend in Columbus. Easton center is slammed ; as it should be! Every eatery is jammed as it should be! So let go to the cheese cake factory where they have the patio closed and 30 sets of people jammed in lobby..... 25% of the seating closed to the public on a holiday weekend. I know , it might rain later today at 6 pm . So let create an environment where people wait and then feel rushed to order and subsequently eat fast. I guess they could turn tables faster this way and generate more volume with implied or applied stressors. Not sure about service though. It&#39;s now been almost 40minutes on a 30 minute wait. Mo managers checking on patrons waiting. Joke<br>Everyone in my group is frantically looking at menu so they can order as soon as we sit. Like that will improve the situation for us or the kitchen.<br>Awful experience.

I love TCF and every chance I get, I am there! Stopped in for dinner with my mom and sister. The wait was about 20 minutes and our waiter was great. Of course, my libation of choice is the J.W.&#39;s Pink Lemonade and I am currently loving the Chicken Littles entree that comes with corn succotash and mashed potatoes. The food and service was great. One of my go-to places whenever I am in Columbus (:

Today my family and I ate at the location in Columbus. OH. We were seated within 15min. It took nearly an hour to get our food. The food came out cold and my daughter&#39;s food was not prepared the way we requested. <br>It was absolutely the worst Cheesecake Factory experience I&#39;ve ever had, and we&#39;ve eaten  at locations all around the country. Will not be returning to this location ever again.

Went to TCF for brunch with the boyfriend. We were seated promptly and didn&#39;t wait long before Harrison, our server greeted us and got our drink orders. Initially I ordered the Bloody Mary, but I wasn&#39;t feeling it. Harrison recommended the mimosa and it was amazing! I had 2 of them! For brunch I ordered the chicken &amp; waffles with eggs Benedict... so delicious! I liked the variety of options on the menu, there&#39;s something on there for everyone. Special thanks to Harrison for treating us so well!

one of the worst experiences we&#39;ve had.  waited long time for poor food.  noodles were undercooked and chicken was rubbery.   salad had no dressing.  when we told the waitress about the food she didn&#39;t even ask if we wanted anything else.  will never go to any of these again. <br><br>your response doesn&#39;t help us any.  you robbed us of our $$.   and that is all you have to say.  no thanks.

This place rocks in being able to eat very well (healthy) and the environment is great!  If cheesecake is your gig then you have a ton of choices!   We split a huge salad , an appetizer, and fillet mignon!    Totally great!   Wait staff is amazing!   Will definitely go back.

Cheesecake Factory is my favorite place to eat. I always get the shrimp scampi bistro style. I am disappointed though because I feel like their portion sizes are getting smaller and smaller but the prices remain high. This particular location is great. The staff is amazing and it doesn&#39;t take too long to be seated on a regular night. If it&#39;s a holiday, be prepared to wait up to 2 hours to be seated. The cheesecake is divine. The ambiance is great.

Very very long wait when I went to this location and staff was not attentive, except for the waiter. New manager used his newness as an excuse for other staff incompetence. Mashed potatoes were just warm and looked glazed over from a heat lamp. Steak was good.

I received gift cards for this restaurant. My wife and I went there and were pleased. The funny thing is that we did not order any cheesecake. We both love cheesecake but the food was so good and filling that we had no room. If you are at the Easton town-center this is the place to eat at.

We frequent this Cheesecake location often since we live close. EVERY experience, our waiter comes back and tells us they are out of something (chicken and biscuits...stuffed chicken tortillas). It never fails. We are actually moving soon so we&#39;re excited to try a different location.

The Cheesecake Factory always has great food. They have an extensive menu and I have yet to order an item I did not enjoy. The meals/flavors are consistent. Service has always been good in my experience. Portions tend to be too large for a single (normal) person so I&#39;d plan on sharing. <br><br>Of course the Cheesecake is what they&#39;re really known for and it is delicious. So try to save room. Otherwise, you can always order a slice for carry out.

I&#39;m not going to blow everyone&#39;s mind with this but it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s completely medium at best. It&#39;s good for a well priced family meal, first date, or a lunch with friends for cheap. The fries are the good kind though so that is a star on its own. And the chicken Madeira and garlic bread are pretty top notch.

Great American Eatery! Yes, a chain restaurant that beat their rivals. The pages on pages of options appease a lot of appetites. The cheesecake and large portions bring us back time after time. The drawbacks are the high drink prices,  both alcohol and non alcohol drinks and lengthy waits without reservation or call ahead capabilities. The service is prompt, friendly and very knowledgeable. The food is made to order and can be modify based on diet restrictions and/or allergies.  Fact: menus across the nation vary depending on regions to cater to the population. The menu will vary depending on if your in Hawaii, California, Florida, Ohio, etc. Make sure you visit another cheesecake factory to check out the variation. Can&#39;t believe it took me so long to review. We adore this restaurant for all of its glory. The changing menu is enough to keep us coming back but the classics will always be there.

Yesterday we made the poor decision to eat at The Cheesecake Factory. We were with extended family so neither my husband nor I spoke up about the quality of our food. I ordered Green Chilaquiles with Carnitas and Eggs.  By the time I got my order the food was cold. The tortilla chips were soggy. It was very unappetizing. My husband ordered the Brunch Combo which is eggs, bacon, and pancakes. He told me his food was cold, as well. I realize that some of the fault lies with us for not speaking up. I did not want to embarrass the others in our party by saying anything. One may be assured I doubt my husband or I will go back.

We came here for lunch on a Saturday around one and this place was packed. Regardless,  the wait for a party of seven was only forty-five minutes. <br><br>The menu here is huge. Overwhelmingly huge. Our waitress was able to name a few of her favorites, but with a menu this big, I feel like you are taking a gamble on quantity over quality. Either way, I had the cashew chicken with brown rice, extra spicy. The sauce was more toward sweet than spicy, but still good. If you like spicy food, I would recommend emphasizing that when you order. For an appetizer, we had the corn tamales. I would not really call them corn tamales. They were more like a sweet corn cake, but they were still good. Everyone at the table seemed pleased with what they ordered. <br><br>Now for the best part, the cheesecake. Order the cheesecake. Is it a little expensive? yes. But just do it. You won&#39;t regret it. So pick one of the many different flavors and ignore the sheer amount of calories. You&#39;ll be glad you did.

Beautiful restaurant, Good cheesecake, food was okay. We had the Mac n cheese burger, but they didn&#39;t put much Mac n cheese on it. The chicken and biscuits was terrible, hard biscuits and not much chicken at all. and Alfredo, which was also just ok, on the dry side. Our server was all over the place, not the greatest service.

The food was decent, the cheesecake was good! The food took too long though. I realize it&#39;s expensive to make a cheesecake but I didn&#39;t think it was THAT expensive... <br>The place was hard to get around and the floor was slippery. I had to look both ways as if I was crossing the street to avoid running into wait staff and/or other patrons. <br>I recommend the Reese&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake if you like the combination of chocolate and peanut butter (and aren&#39;t allergic to peanuts)

Nicolette is a terrible person to have representing your brand. My pager went off so I made my way to the counter. Stood there and waited patiently. They were busy. Nicolette didn&#39;t look up from her computer other than to take my blinking pager without a word to me. I stood there waiting for about 5 minutes after she took my pager as they took table after table. I Said excuse me miss. She did not look up nor acknowledge me. So I said ma&#39;am in a little louder voice still no acknowledgment but this time the lady farther away heard me and said I can help you. I said I&#39;m trying to get this lady&#39;s attention who took my blinking pager. At this point Nicolette has a smirk on her face. She finally looked up at me and I said this is no way to treat a customer. She just looked at me with her smirk not saying a word still, so realizing I am making no progress I ask for the manager. Who happened to walk up. I explained to him what had transpired he did apologize and I asked for her name. Which he gave me. He explained to me that she takes the pager prints out a paper and puts it in a stager which is then taken by the other hostesses who seat you in order. I told him the hostess station is no place for a passive aggressive personality and maybe he should redistribute her elsewhere for someone who enjoys customer interaction. Doubt he will have time to do it since he was working harder than she was. Turns out he is the restaurants GM. The GM stopped by several times checking on us. The food we ordered came out quick and tasty as it always does at this Cheesecake Factory. We will be back but hopefully we won&#39;t run into Nicolette.
My order was wrong, waiter was rude, food sucked, and way over priced.

The food and drinks are are always on point. However, be prepared to wait for about an hour or more on the weekends. The Asian pear martini is really good but a bit on the sweet side. We also got a few apps like the fried Mac and cheese, avocado egg rolls, and the buffalo blasts. All delicious!

After waiting for about 10 minutes to even be greeted by the busy staff, we were led to our table by a frazzled host who kept either changing his mind or was confused about where to seat us. <br><br>Once we were seated, we noticed that the restaurant was cramped and loud. The din of room was saturated with the sounds of screaming kids, the bustling, open kitchen, and harried servers which made it feel like a hospital cafeteria.  We couldn&#39;t decide on the theme of the decor, either. Egyptian? Havana? Tropical? Ancient Roman? <br><br>Anyway, the place was so busy that the servers seemed to not be able to keep up. Our server was pleasant, but forgetful. We were finished eating for almost 30 minutes receiving our check while we watched other tables come and go. <br><br>The food was ok, chain restaurant quality.  Portions were small for the price, but my blueberry mojito was pretty good. Overall, I was underwhelmed yet overestimulated by the busy, noisy atmosphere.

I don&#39;t think anyone needs another review for this chain,  but I wanted to review the &#34;skinny menu&#34;. Be very careful if you are trying to be healthy at the Cheesecake factory and ordering off their regular menu.  Even some of their salads are over 1700 calories! I have tried 3 things from the skinny menu and each dish has been great. I have tried two salads and the turkey burger.  Everything was excellent which surprised me considering how low in calories and fat they all are.  I definitely recommend their skinny menu. Don&#39;t be afraid to try it because I am a fat kid and I honestly enjoyed everything I have tried from this menu. Since you are ordering from the skinny menu, you might as well split a piece of cheesecake with someone. Just don&#39;t look at the calories,  sugar, fat, or carbohydrates unless you want to cry.

I have to update my review. This location just can&#39;t handle that traffic it seems. We&#39;ve been here several times in the last two years, because it is closer than that Polaris location, and everyone we say we won&#39;t come back. We mean it this time. We don&#39;t mind waiting to be seated. That&#39;s to be expected. But the quality of service here is despicable. Yes, it&#39;s that bad. Maybe it is a hiring issue. A training issue. I have no idea. I get better service at Applebee&#39;s or any other cheaper restaurant than at this location. And for the prices here...they should be ashamed. I&#39;ll go to Polaris from here out...totally worth the extra 20 minute or so drive. What a shame! I do not recommend this to anyone who would like to be greeted, have their drink orders taken, or have bread to munch on within 10 of being seated.

The atmosphere is nice nut food just a little above average. I mean nothing tjat blows your mind and I&#39;ve had several dishes here. Today I ordered the orange chicken and was not impressed. The chicken was hard and lack flavor. The glaze was barely on the chicken so I had to request more. The cheese cake was just ok which was the carmel salted version. The sweetness of the glaze and the crust fought each other way too much. Now the service was excellent no complaints what so ever. Order was correct and she recommended the lunch portion which was still huge. I say come give it a whirl and enjoy an outing.

Had the fried chicken sliders which were the best chicken sandwiches any of us have ever had - total perfection.  I also had mac and cheese which was just good - nothing overly impressive.  My wife had chicken and mushroom wraps and did not care for them much due to an undesirable aftertaste.  My daughter had a grilled chicken salad which she must of liked as she finished most of it.<br><br>Our biggest problem wasn&#39;t the food but was the location of our table.  We were sandwiched in between two tables of people and there was zero privacy.  When the waitress would wait on either of the tables to the left or right of us, her butt was way too close to me - very uncomfortable.  The second issue was the noise level.  I hate being stressed out when I&#39;m eating.  I&#39;m stressed out enough at my job and don&#39;t have the desire to deal with more stress when I&#39;m trying to relax in my limited time off.  Those sliders were damn good, but I don&#39;t think I could go through that again.  Maybe next time I&#39;ll have a glass of wine before we go so I won&#39;t be so stressed.  Do people actually like eating in this type of environment?  I certainly don&#39;t get it.
Went in and got a slice of Smores Cheesecake. Took a while just to get a slice with no communication, but boy was it good! Very rich with a good presentation.

Really can&#39;t rate this place since we never ate. Upon arrival we told them we wanted a table in the bar the hostess said it would be a few minutes. We&#39;ll after 45 minutes and watching droves of people come and go I still waited because no one was coming and going from the bar area were we was wanting to be seated. Then all of a sudden they started taking couples to the bar. My husband asked why we had been over looked. She asked his name, then could not find it. I was ready to leave then they found us a table so off I went, only to be seated in a cramped little half table up against a wall with children jumping on the seats next to me. I got up and left. I&#39;m not rating the food here since I never had any but I will rate the staff. I will not go back.

So..I hear they have a HUGE menu?! ;) We stopped to have a piece of cheesecake and a drink. Now, I don&#39;t mind paying top $$ for food and/or drink but this caught me off guard. CF is known for their cheesecake and I don&#39;t mind paying $7-$8 for it, it&#39;s all spectacular. We ordered 2 pieces of Cheesecake, 1 glass of sangria and some fruity drink for the little lady...$38. Which was expected until I noticed the drinks were $10 each?! I am more than happy to pay $10<br>for their AWESOME cheesecakes but not for watered down desert drinks. But I still love the cheesecake, unfortunately.

The Corn fritter platter was outstanding the taste is extremely authentic and it&#39;s quite large it was amazing home cooked meal feel , the chicken tacos from the skinny menu are wrapped in lettuce and have avocado chicken and veggies inside , they  were great and healthy ! Finally the dulce de leche cheesecake was ridiculously great SO good! For a chain restaurant this place has my vote !

My wife and I were visiting my sister-in-law in New Albany, Ohio. We went to the afternoon show today (Sunday) in Easton and afterwards stopped at the Cheesecake Factory for cocktails and dinner. When we sat down and ordered drinks we asked the waitress for some bread to absorb the alcohol since we had not eaten today.  Her response was they only had some hard bread but would bring us some once she had some fresh.  We asked her several times during our drinks and then dinner and still no bread.  When we were finished after close to an hour still waiting for bread.  I asked for the manager before we paid the check.  He approached the table with an artificial frozen smile on his face and responded we can take bread home I told him we were not looking for a carry out and would have liked a piece of bread during our drinks or over dinner.  That was his answer to our complaint.  I told him it would ha have been easier just to leave and never come back to Cheesecake Factory but I was more concerned to share our experience about the evidently poor kitchen management for the future.  I really don&#39;t think he fully understood customer satisfaction and the value of feedback.  Not sure if it&#39;s a way to cut cost or what but poor experience especially when you pay a tab around one hundred bucks,  I would not recommend Cheesecake Factory  Easton location.

My favorite restaurant in the world...lol I always enjoy the food here and this time in OH wasn&#39;t any different. This time I had Philly cheesesteak and it was just as good the next day we I reheated it. Waiter was a bit slow but hey it what it is.

I thought it was great. The wait wasn&#39;t long, our waitress was nice and the food tasted wonderful. I had the veggie burger, mom had the turkey burger, dad had the Cuban sandwich, and my niece had a kids cheese pizza. The prices are fair because you get quite a lot. Didn&#39;t really like the strawberry lemonade and my mom didn&#39;t like the garden house salad because it was romaine lettuce. Oh she was also disappointed in the cheese cake because it wasn&#39;t all that but she like it. Overall nice.

I normally love the Cheesecake and always end an evening of Easton shopping by picking my up a few pieces of cheesecake and taking them back to the hotel.<br>However on this particular night I had a takeout piece of Red Velvet. Service was horrific and they kind of threw the cheesecake upside down in the box.<br>Once I settled in at the hotel , I noticed the frosting had an off taste but plowed forward - bad decision. About 4 hours later I was awoken with an uncontrollable need to upchuck which lasted about an hour.<br>I then remember the weird, sour frosting.<br> No more Cheesecake Factory for me.

Service at this place is terrible even on weekdays when the restaurant is nearly empty. The place is empty on a Monday &amp; we had to wait 15 minutes for bread that we were told was being baked only to get stale bread. We ordered one dish that took 45 minutes to serve.
This is strictly for the bartender.  Be friendlier!  I decided to get my food to go!  Not sure if she was having a bad day or not, but she was putting off some bad vibes.

I thought their hostess was a bit unfriendly and could have sworn a couple of other groups who came in after were seated before us... but I won&#39;t hold a grudge because everything else was satisfactory.<br><br>I wanted to sit outside on a patio somewhere in Easton to have a drink or two. The Cheesecake Factory has a fairly large outside seating area so we opted for them.  I was glad to have a much friendlier waiter!  I&#39;m a fan of their &#39;small plates and snacks&#39; page in their menu.  We ordered the Warm Crab and Artichoke Dip as well as their pear and brie pizzette. The dip is addicting (as expected) and the pizzette is not for everyone. It may be an acquired taste for some but i like brie cheese and thought it was a creative addition to their menu.<br><br>I like this restaurant because it&#39;s for everyone and I think everyone can find something they like. It may be a chain but it&#39;s a notch above and certainly not an Applebee&#39;s or a TGIFriday. It&#39;s great because they were able to create a place where people will come so many reasons. Whether it&#39;s celebrating important events like their birthday or anniversary, a place to have a drink at the bar, just to buy a cheesecake, or to dine with their little kids and know they&#39;ll make a huge mess!

One word: AMAZING! <br><br>My first time going, and LOVED it. <br><br>To start off we had the fried calamari which was fantastic. They have really good lemonade and I ordered their jalapeño pineapple margarita they have which was quite interesting. <br><br>My date ordered filet mignon, Medium Rare and it was to die for! Melt in your mouth, cooked phenomenally! I ordered the Steak Diana, cooked Medium with Salmon. The Steak was ok. And the salmon was good without the lemon sauce they put underneath. Didn&#39;t care for it at all. <br><br>Their mashed potato&#39;s were way too salty and my date pointed it out to the manager and the manager asked to take them back and we declined just letting him know so he could tell his cooks. The manager then told us he would give us a piece of cheesecake on the house. <br><br>We also had a plate of macaroni and cheese which I must say was the best Mac n cheese I&#39;ve ever had in my life. Order it! You&#39;ll thank me later.<br><br>At the end we ordered a piece of lemon meringue cheesecake and white chocolate chip macadamia nut. Both...... Out of this world. Could be just because I&#39;m a cheesecake fanatic! <br><br>I wish I could remember our waiters name cause he was pretty awesome!

Stopped in for dinner with some friends.  The meal was pretty good overall, but the cheesecake was the star of the show.  The menu is huge which can make it hard to narrow down what you want, but also to maintain standards of quality.

I&#39;m giving this four stars only because the service was a bit slow, and our daughters&#39; orange chicken entree&#39; that they split wasn&#39;t &#34;orange chicken&#34; according to them, it wasn&#39;t sweet or tangy enough.  <br><br>Other than that this place is amazing! I ordered a slice of the Godiva chocolate cheesecake that was way off the charts - it was heavenly! I love very rich decadent chocolate...the &#34;crust&#34; or whatever was what I believe to be dark chocolate and the middle part like a chocolate mousse (it is flourless), also with a chocolate wafer square on top of it!  It was so rich that my daughter and I had to get a box and there was still 1/4 left which we shared the next day, lol.  My other daughter and her boyfriend ordered the tuxedo cheesecake which they very much enjoyed.  It was my older daughter&#39;s birthday so I told the server then about five or six wait staff came out and sang happy birthday with her cheesecake decorated with some sprinkles and a candle in the whipped cream, a very nice festive touch! It was definitely a birthday to remember for her and we most likely will come back next year for her Sweet 16th!

I love Cheesecake Factory because of the vast menu and the chicken maderia is my go-to dish. Still great food at this location but the service was slow and we were not served the bread. Not exactly a good situation when you&#39;re starving.

I usually love this place but I am now considering going to other restaurants in the area after my visit today. After church my husband, mother and I decided to go to the Easton Towne Center location and it was not a good experience. Service was extremely slow! It took so long for our food that we forgot that we were hungry. Then when our food came, my husbands food was missing main items in his dish. He ordered the Jambalaya Hash and Eggs (not sure if this is the correct name but it&#39;s close and on the brunch menu) Well, there were no potatoes or sausage in his meal...That was very odd. I ordered the Eggplant Parmesan and it wasn&#39;t good at all...I should have stuck to what I normally get. We did not want to return the food because that&#39;s pretty annoying and will be thrown out. There are people less fortunate in the world who are not able to enjoy a meal so we try not to waste food. Our waitress told us that she would speak to the manager to see if anything could be done but she never gave updates and brought our bill. I spent $74 on poor service and bad food today...That really bothers me.

I am usually a fan of TCF - I have been to locations all over So Cal. This one is located inside Easton Town Center and perhaps that is why it is so hard to get good service.<br><br>We had a group of about 10 and had to wait almost 40 minutes for a table. We actually only got seated after talking to the manager.<br><br>Once we were seated, they were pretty quick taking the orders and bringing us some complimentary apps, however it took a long time for us to get the entrees... a one hour lunch ended up taking us 3 hours.<br><br>The food was fine and as usual the menu is massive. I always have The Navajo sandwich when I go there, fry bread and avocado (you can&#39;t hate that). It was good.<br><br>Parking was torture. People were actually stalking everyone who would leave the shops to see where they were parked and try to get their spot. I think the service really suffers from the location, but then again.. that is why it is so popular as well.
Food was good. We were full so we got our cheesecakes to go. Mine (chocolate mousse) tasted freezer burnt but the Oreo did not.

I&#39;m not much of a chain-goer, but I have to admit I do really like The Cheesecake Factory.  A year or so ago I would have given around 3 stars for not really being my thing, but ever since they introduced the small-plates and &#39;skinnylicious&#39; (questionable marketing decision there) menus, I&#39;m a fan! <br><br>My favorite way to dine here is to order a bottle of their house Cabernet (around $30), split one of the bigger appetizer salads (~$10) and then a few small plates to share (ranging from $4-$8). It&#39;s for sure enough to share between 2 people and we leave feeling great - not uncomfortably full with 3 pounds of leftovers in a to-go bag. <br><br>Service is usually pretty great and no one seems to mind a couple of people enjoying a leisurely shared dinner, even on a  semi-busy night. <br><br>Seriously, try the small plates!

I will never come here again. We have been here for almost an hour without anyone let know what is going on. To top it all off my friend order crisp Cuban rolls and she was told they were out and she ordered an another item and then they came back they were out. Not happy!

I would give 0 stars if I could. Every time we eat here, dine in or carry out, we have an issue. Last time my quesadilla was soggy because the salsa soaked into it. Once we waited over an hour for food when two tables seated after us got there&#39;s just fine. This time I&#39;m done. I will never go to this location again. My steak was supposed to be medium well, NOT burnt on the outside. I have two mushrooms and a disgusting pile of salty onions. This is beyond ridiculous and j paid $20 for this!!! - See picture!!!

I&#39;ve eaten at cheesecake factory many times over the years and this restaurant about 6. <br>  I have to say this was by far the worst service I have ever had at ccf.   The server seemed annoyed by us from the start.   The restaurant wasn&#39;t that busy even though it is close to Christmas. We were there at an off peak time.   <br><br>Our food arrived at a reasonable time except for one meal.   It took another 7 minutes for the last meal to arrive. I swear they must have dropped it or forgot it (it was the lunch portion of the full meal I had. Go figure!). We all tried to be polite and wait but our food was getting cold. <br><br>Once the food arrived our server disappeared.  We asked a different server for more bread but ccf must be on a cost cutting program.   It never arrived.   When our server finally came back we asked for more bread again.   She repeated the request, asking in an incredulous tone, &#34;MORE bread? &#34;, like we couldn&#39;t possibly need more.<br><br>On to desert.   It is, after all, the reason you go there. The cheesecake was solid and did not disappoint. Cost cutting is going on with the cheesecake as well. No longer are the portions overflowing the plate! Normal portions! Price is the same, however.   And, note to staff, unless you plan to eat it with your fingers one needs a fork.   We had none.   A fact the server could have noted when she cleaned our plates.  So being the patient customer I am, I asked for forks.   She said she&#39;d go find some and brought back 2.  Only 1 problem, there were 5 of us! So I sent her scurrying off in a huff for 3 more. <br><br>Needles to say her tip reflected her level of poor service. I won&#39;t be back anytime soon.

All my my the food was terrific!! My wife and I were expecting good food but &#34;Bam&#34;It was very almost perfect!!! Highly recommend the New York,but really dont think you can go wrong with anything they offer! Also the folks working their tale off from kitchen to waitresses&amp;waiters all deserve a raise!! great experience,most definitely going back!! Whatcha waiting for?!?!get off your tail and go &#34;GETCHA SUM&#34;!!
Bang Bang Chicken! Yummy! Hubby enjoyed his Hibachi Steak as well! Very busy! Waiter was disappointing... never came back for refills. Nice Easton location! Beautiful decor.

I remember my first visit, it was great. Now it&#39;s just loud, uncomfortable seating next to strangers, so so food with giant portions.  The menu is all over the board, way too many items to do a good job.  <br><br>I ordered the Southern Catfish, very over cooked, served with a pound of mashed potatoes, corn and green beans.  My wife had corn chowder.  We both ordered cheesecake.  60.00 later we head home to eat our cheesecake at home without two families sitting on both sides of us stare at our plates.<br><br>The pumpkin cheesecake is wonderful. Next time I&#39;ll pickup a salad at Wendy&#39;s then swing by for dessert to go.

I have been to the Cheesecake Factory a hand full of times now. It&#39;s never my suggestion to go there but I have never had a bad experience. I have sampled drinks, appetizers and deserts only....so I cannot speak for their dinner or lunch plates.<br><br>Drinks - are pretty good, no unique drinks on the menu but the classics are pretty solid. They even have a happy hour with some good deals from 4-6.<br><br>Appetizers - I have tried several and they were all yummy. The chicken pot stickers were probably my favorite, crab drip is great.<br><br>Desserts - are of course the hi-light. cheesecake of countless varieties - The Lemon Raspberry Creme is so good but none will disappoint you, count on that. Their tiramisu was also really good - I was really surprised.<br><br>The vibe inside is chill and the service has always been good whether I was at the bar or a table.

this place was really good the portions are HUGE it really filled me up not to mention to great service with waiters and waitresses always checking in :) the cheesecake is really good too this was a great place to eat at. the prices weren&#39;t crazy at all and everyone here was very polite. glad i stopped by 11/10 u keep doing u cheesecake factory

Excited to see that they take reservations for parties of 7 or more... <br><br>...LESS exited to find out that it&#39;s only before 4pm.  <br><br>I was trying to book ahead of time for a party of ten, on a Wednesday, for a special event where I&#39;ll have older family members in town.  I had hoped to be able to bring them in and sit down.  Why take reservations at all?<br><br>This is a review based on company policy... not based on food.

I would give it zero stars if I could but that would be completely fair to the waiter who was great. They don&#39;t have enough staff to meet business needs. The waiting time was terrible. The food was a disaster. My omelette was so bad I wouldn&#39;t feed it to a starving child in Africa and my sister&#39;s meatloaf was burnt more than a hippy at Woodstock.

The cheesecakes here are really good. My favorite is the new york cheesecake or the chocolate raspberry, both are quite decadent. The food is standard fare. Gigantic portions, generally taste fine but nothing stands out and the pasta dishes can be quite greasy. Unless you&#39;re really hungry, plan on taking some home. The cocktail menu is extensive and the mimosa and  the margaritas are quite good. Nice place but I wouldn&#39;t wait for an hour to be seated, which is what you should expect on a weekend night.

Love the Shepard&#39;s Pie. Great for Gluten Free folks. The menu is massive, but lots of good things for us Gluten Free eaters. I say it&#39;s a must.BTW our server was so nice. Really went out of his way to make sure our business meal went well.

For a chain restaurant I would give it 5 stars but overall a solid 4 stars.<br>We hadn&#39;t been to Cheesecake Factory in years (last time in Beveryly Hills, CA) and didn&#39;t remember it being anything special.<br>This time we had a gift card and were shopping at Easton and figured to give it another chance.<br>We got there monday at 5 with minimal wait and once we saw the happy hour menu decided to sit at the bar.<br>Service was very nice and super fast, we were on an out in an hour.<br>The prices are steep for a chain restaurant, there was no way I was going to pay $25+ for some fish so once I saw they have a housemade veggie burger I had to give it a try.<br>It was pretty good, not as good as Northstar or some others but descent.<br>The house sald with ginger soy super yummy, best dressing ever!<br>We got a bunch of $5 plates the guys favorite was the mac n cheese balls, the burger sliders were also pretty good, the chicken sliders ok but not much chicken, really more bread and breading than anything else.<br>The tex mex egg rolls were fine, I loved the avocado spread with it.<br>The chicken potstickers were also good.<br>Portions for apps were pretty big, you get alot more than at any other restaurant we&#39;ve been to and for $5 a good deal.<br>I just can&#39;t jutify paying $7 for a slice of cake so I&#39;ve yet to try that but I did stand there and drool for a few minutes....

Many already know what The Cheesecake Factory is all about-a lot of love/hate out there. Consensus is that they have a huge menu (and servings) of food-burgers, pasta, pizza, salads, seafood, steaks, etc, etc. Not great on beer selection-Blue Moon is as &#34;exotic&#34; as they get. However, many don&#39;t know of their Sunday Brunch-that&#39;s right, Sunday Brunch. <br><br>One of the cool things about Yelping is hearing something many don&#39;t know about, hopping on here and sharing that info. Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. Sorry, I was rambling so I jumped straight to it. This is my favorite item on their brunch menu. Pancakes? Yes. So what. So what? Here&#39;s what-buttermilk pancakes with ricotta cheese and lemon zest. Sounds so simple doesn&#39;t it? Is it Sunday yet? They&#39;re so light, fluffy, moist and ...refreshing? It&#39;s the lemon zest-so good. A must try.<br><br>...also, the Pineapple Upside Down Cheesecake. Dear God. I grew up loving this cake and when I tried CF&#39;s cheesecake version I just stared at it after one bite.
Nice setting, waiter was friendly. Wait was over 1.2hrs to seat. Food took another hour to arrive. Food quality was average. (Had a lone burger and enchilada). Honestly is it worth the wait? No

Another good place to enjoy variety and quality of food.  It does get crowded and wait time varies it can be up to 20 minutes or more but I assure you it is all worth it.  Friendly staff huge menu loaded with delicious food order anything it is a win win you will be walking out with a happy face:-) . Make sure you are starving when you want to get there because they are quite generous in food portion :-)

I&#39;ve been to at least 20 different Cheesecake Factories across the country since I travel a lot for work, and this is hands down the worst one. I honestly didn&#39;t think the food and service could be so different, but wow, the food was almost inedible.<br><br>I always order the same things - miso salmon, dynamite shrimp and carrot cake. The salmon and miso sauce were literally disgusting. Not even sure what I was eating and pray I don&#39;t get sick later tonight. The dynamite shrimp was far from dynamite. I just left there and am so disappointed to have to write this terrible review, but THE FOOD WAS AWFUL. I come to Columbus a few times a month and will never dine here again. There are much better options at Easton.

There&#39;s an endless amount of national chains available for lunch or dinner when shopping in Easton. Some are good. Others, not so much. Meanwhile, there&#39;s two things you can count on at this Cheesecake Factory: an endless amount of choices and consistency. This is one of the better Cheesecake Factory&#39;s in the country, and I&#39;ve been to many of them over the years. Great location, too. <br><br>There&#39;s no point in going through what&#39;s good and bad on the menu. I&#39;m guessing anyone that would shop in this area has been here or to one of the many locations nationwide before. We all know there&#39;s nothing bad on the menu and portions are huge!

Food poisoning! My best friend and I had a birthday lunch this afternoon. I got the orange chicken and she got chicken carbonara. I immediately felt ill so much I couldn&#39;t finish. My best friend called me later today to say she&#39;s been vomiting all evening. Not sure what&#39;s going on there, maybe they&#39;re not cleaning or prepping food right. Skip this place.

I love the food at the Cheesecake factory!! My favorite is the bang bang chicken and shrimp. And it&#39;s one of the best things for you (calorie-wise) on the menu. <br><br>This particular location is usually rather busy, being in Easton and all. I went on a Thursday evening with my parents and our wait was around 30-35 minutes.....but the people watching was good....plus, we also had a menu and it took about that long to look through it to find out what we wanted! :o)<br><br>The only thing I don&#39;t like about this place is that their prices keep going up. I&#39;m kind&#39;ve a tight-wad...especially around the holidays. My favorite dish (bang bang chicken &amp; shrimp) is now $17.95. And that&#39;s just for the actual meal. If you want a caesar salad (side salad) is $8.95. Really??!! And then of course you have to have dessert. In my case it&#39;s either carrot cake or one of the chocolate cakes because I just don&#39;t like cheesecake. <br><br>This is a good place to go one in a while....but I&#39;m not willing to submit to the rediculous prices on a routine basis.

This is the first time I ate a Cheesecake Factory and it didn&#39;t disappoint. The menu could be a bit overwhelming because of all number of selections and to make it worse everything looked good. I ended up going with the Pasta Carbonara which was beyond amazing. The service was friendly and even though it was busy our food came out pretty quick. To top it off I had a piece of vanilla bean cheesecake. My only complaint was that the unsweetened tea tasted more like green tea then black but not the end of the world. Would definitely return!

What you expect from a Cheesecake Factory is what you get.  The food was actually slightly above average, which was a pleasant surprise.  No surprise on the bill; for one entree, water and dessert the bill was still $25 before tip! High, I think, but oh well.<br>Service was good.
Always good at accommodating big parties. Enjoy going here after church with the family.

Visited on March 5th. A nice weather day, Easton and the  resteraunt were both very busy. I submitted my name for the 20 minutes wait. Went to the bar and ordered a Kentucky mule,a bourbon drink. The drink was 10$ it tasted terrible, worse I&#39;ve ever had, I paid with a hundred dollar bill, and was given my change in one&#39;s and fives. When we got our booth, the waiter was rushing back and forth, was definitely not interested in spending time with us. The entire visit we were made to feel as though we were in the way. This used to be a great place to go. And it may still be, just not on Sunday March 5th 2017. As expensive as this place is, service should be better.. This was probably our last visit. Too many other options in cbus

One of my all time favorite restaurants!  I am 100% in love with the Cheesecake Factory, and I am NOT afraid to admit it.<br><br>1st up:  APPETIZERS  YAY!!, Ok, so I have only had 1 of their appetizers, but after tasting their chicken quesadilla why would I ever get anything else???  I have been to several Mexican restaurants and have NEVER had one as good as this.  I have even tried to duplicate it at home (to no avail) it&#39;s so good.  <br><br>Next up:  Main Courses!!  Chicken &amp; Biscuits.  So good, so so good.  My mouth is watering just thinking about the super moist chicken, sweet carrots, flaky biscuits and unique gravy.  This dish makes my taste buds sing. This is definitely my favorite entree-period.<br><br>I have also had their Chicken &amp; Avocado sandwich that comes with french fries.  This sandwich, my friends, is super tasty.  When I first ordered this I was slightly leary of the combination, but don&#39;t be hesitant like I was.  Jump into it full force because it is the shiznit.<br><br>My husband gets their shrimp bistro pasta.  He says it has a great flavor to it and he orders this every time we go.  I CANNOT vouch for this because I will NEVER taste it, because as most of you know you eat with your eyes first and something about this dish just appears unappealing to me and I refuse to put a bite of it anywhere near my mouth.  Sorry, I&#39;m just weird like that.<br><br>I have tasted their pizza, it&#39;s mighty good too.  My kids have gotten their chicken fingers on MANY occasions, and they always gobble them up with a quickness.<br><br>Their brown bread is soft, and just plain good.  We always ask for all brown bread when we go here because we are not big fans of the harder sourdough bread (they can keep that stuff).<br><br>Now to my favorite part. What they are known best for...CHEESECAKE!  I have tried so many I don&#39;t even know where to start.  I will tell you my absolute favorite is the lemon raspberry one.  It is so light and fluffy and not as heavy as most of the other flavors.  Others I have tried that are fabulous as well are,  Adam&#39;s<br>Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple, Ultimate Red Velvet, Oreo (the regular one is good, the chocolate oreo one is gross--tell them no thank you on that one), Chocolate Tuxedo (yuk--avoid this one too), White Chocolate Blueberry, Carmel Pecan Turtle Cheesecake, and I am sure there are many other.  All of the cheesecakes I have tasted (other than the ones listed with bad comments beside them) and been wonderful.<br><br>I would recommend this spot for a friends night out or a family outing.  Either way, you will get good food.

Was this for real? I went with my two daughters for a Sunday brunch. I ordered a black coffee for myself and water for the table. Later I ordered the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes to split with my daughter and another kids&#39; French toast. When the food came 30 minutes later we noticed the food tasted like coffee. Both of the small metal carafes that were supposed to be filled with syrup were filled with black coffee instead! Needless to say both of our meals were ruined when we poured coffee over our food. When I told the waiter about the problem he said that I ordered it that way. What??? I have never even heard of pouring coffee over lemon pancakes let alone ordering coffee to pour over my 11 year old&#39;s French toast. The manager at first was going to comp us for only one meal until I had to explain again that both meals were ruined. I wish we were more patient and had waited in the line at North Star. There is a reason their line is out the door and not at Cheesecake.

My husband, daughter and I went here the other night. My husband had some gift cards he wanted to use. Typically, we don&#39;t come to the Cheesecake Factory for dinner. When we were in there, that&#39;s what we wanted.<br>Their food is... okay. Their menu is huge, and it&#39;s almost as if they are trying to cater to whatever you have a craving for. This makes it a bit hard to choose what you want. I ordered the Shepard&#39;s pie - and it was... eh. I have never had Shepard&#39;s pie before, but I would definitely say that it&#39;s not very authentic. It seemed like it was something that they had thrown together in the kitchen, and topped with Mashed potatoes. The Potatoes were fine, but I wasn&#39;t too keen on eating the rest of it. <br>The waitstaff was pretty good, considering we arrived a half hour before close. The food took a bit longer to come out, and it was whatever for us.<br>The Cheesecake is amazing though! I would definitely recommend coming for Cheesecake, but if you want a meal, go somewhere else.

I ordered a Creamsicle from the bar while waiting for a table outside on the patio by the fire.  It was delicious but since it was  $11,  I only had one.  We were seated, asked for water, and 20 minutes later received water.  We had the firecracker salmon for an appetizer.  It was very delicious.  They brought out my steak before my salad so I sent the salad back.  The steak was very yummy and so were the green beans, even though I ordered broccoli.  Halfway through the meal I had to tell the waiter our drink glasses were empty and he also forgot to give us bread. My bf did not enjoy his chicken  Marsala.  The sauce was very thin.  He said olive garden is so much better.  We also  got a raspberry white chocolate cheesecake to go and they were out of plastic forks. Excellent food.  Very poor service.

Our waitress was Patricia and she did a fantastic job!!  The restaurant was extremely busy but Patricia seemed calm, collective, and friendly.  I do think the restaurant had difficulty keeping up with the pace of customer orders.  Orders were not coming out together and people had to wait while others in their groups were eating.  As did I have to wait while my table received their food first.  But Patricia was so gracious that I didn&#39;t mind :)<br><br>And they really should have wifi - who doens&#39;t have wifi nowadays :)

Burger wasn&#39;t cooked. Came out raw in the middle. Sent it back and when it came back out it was nasty. Instead of making a new burger, they brought out the one I had taken a bite out of. They obviously put it back on the grill to cook it a bit more. Waitress treated me as if I didn&#39;t know what I was talking about and gave me a nasty look. She said I had ordered it like that. Not once did I say I wanted it raw in the middle. Fries and cheesecake was the only good thing about my order. The other 3 orders were fine.

This location is always very crowded. With that being said, the Cheesecake is amazing. My favorite on the menu is the bang bang chicken and shrimp. Tastes like curry, which I love. Can&#39;t really go wrong here, unless you&#39;re in a hurry

Ordered simple spaghetti. They brought out a small plate of noodles with a side of spaghetti sauce that was in a condiment dish? I asked for more sauce, was brought another condiment size marinara sauce that was cold. At this point my noodles are cold and I&#39;m over the whole meal. Asked the waiter to just take it off my bill and bring me the check. This just seems like too easy of a dish to be screwed up this badly.

I&#39;ve been a fan of the Cheesecake Factory for years. I have never had a bad experience and I&#39;ve been to several in multiple states. I don&#39;t care that the menu gives War and Peace a run for it&#39;s money, I don&#39;t care that one meal likely meets a weeks worth of calories, and I definitely don&#39;t care that it&#39;s a chain.<br><br>The phrase jack of all trades master of none does not apply to Cheesecake Factory because everything they do, they do well. From appetizer to dessert it is can&#39;t miss. AND THE PORTIONS ARE SO LARGE THEY DESERVE A SENTENCE IN ALL CAPS. <br><br>The chicken madiera is one of their most popular dishes and if you try it you will see why. My favorite menu item has actually been of the menu for years, but as sad as that is, I can always drown out the memory with an appetizer, entree and dessert. And of course, cheesecakes are their namesake, and the have about a billion to choose from. But seriously, the list is 50+ cheesecakes of which I&#39;ve probably had between 10-15. My favorite is the Red Velvet and it is not so rich that I can&#39;t eat it in a single sitting. Some cheesecakes, like the Godiva or Tuxedo are too rich not to be spread out over the next day or so. The Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake is always a good choice if you opt not to go the cheesecake route.<br><br>The one downside is that this place is always packed during peak hours but it is worth the wait. We will definitely be back which is probably the most important test of any restaurant.
Great food, seating methods needs some work since our table was given away. All worth the cheesecake.

Usually this is a decent place, but the service was horrible! They were out of food at 12p on a Monday! Someone in the party upcharged on their drink refill &amp; they charged for both. This customer didn&#39;t even eat!!! The manager Brittany drug a napkin through someone&#39;s plate &amp; laughed about. Epic fail today!

There is really only one word to describe The Cheesecake Factory: M&#39;eh. Judging from the ambiance and prices, this restaurant attempts to market itself as a sophisticated, up-scale dining option. What this restaurant achieves superficially, it missed the mark in substance. Unfortunately, there isn&#39;t much about this place that would commend itself to those seeking an enjoyable night out - especially considering what you&#39;ll end up paying. <br><br>On the few occasions I&#39;ve eaten here, it has always been exceedingly crowded regardless of the day. On my most recent visit, my wife and I were packed into a row of tables like sardines. We ended sitting elbow-to-elbow with a group of rambunctious, Australian muscle-heads who spent the evening bragging about their most recent DUIs. The whole restaurant was extremely loud (Australians notwithstanding) so much so that we could barely carry on a private conversation. <br><br>The food was overall very average. The offerings and quality are about what you might expect from TGI Fridays, just 50% more expensive. The service was okay, and the wait times were a bit longer than what you&#39;d like.<br><br>The only reason I bumped this review up to 3 stars was because of the cheesecake. In this realm, they certainly live up to their reputation. The variety and overall deliciousness of the dessert menu was the evening&#39;s saving grace. But, you can always just buy a cheesecake to go, and skip the unwanted invasions on your wallet and personal space.

Had dinner here last night celebrating a friend&#39;s birthday. Sat us in the very back of the restaurant. Our table was under an air conditioning vent and it was freezing cold. Complained to the waitress who told us the air conditioning was controlled out of state so they couldn&#39;t do anything. We all basically ordered appetizers for dinner and it took over a half hour to get our food. I ordered salad and the sausage ricotta Flatbread, brought the Flatbread out before the salad and it was just warm, didn&#39;t seem to be cooked all the way. Unfortunately, I was on a time constraints so didn&#39;t have time to wait for another. Another girl in the group had to wait 20 min for a refill and her food was also just warm. We only had 5 in our group so not a big amount to wait on. Service very slow. Was not happy at all with this visit.

Went for happy hour,  the J.W. lemonade was great,  and the variety of appetizers are delicious especially the sweet corn tamales,  yummo! Had the salted carmel cheesecake wasn&#39;t at all salted carmel, they should just say carmel cheesecake,  but was so happy that the waitress gave me extra carmel, Fun time all the way around.

In the afternoon, on a weekday, my wife and I stopped here to eat a late lunch. The place was not busy and we saw that only a few people were outside eating. We decided to ask for outside seating. Even though there were seats galore inside and out, we were told that there would be a 15 minute wait no matter what area we chose.<br><br>There were a few people ahead of us and were being called.  While waiting, we looked outside and felt like it might rain so we approached the desk to tell them that we would like to change to an inside table.  At that time we were told that our name had already been called. There was absolutely no way we had been called since we had not left the area.<br><br>Since we had supposedly missed our call, the lady told us that we would then be &#34;put back into the rotation.&#34; We didn&#39;t know what that meant, but soon found out. The next name called was that of a couple who came after us. The next name was another couple after us. We got the idea.  At that point we decided that a table for us could not be found and that our business was not desired.  We got up to walk out and once they saw us leaving, they quickly called our name, but we continued to walk out.  We took a short walk to PF Changs, walked directly in, was immediately waited on and had a great meal.<br><br>If you want to be told to sit and cool your heals go here, otherwise go somewhere else.

This is another chain restaurant that I love to visit! The times that I&#39;ve gone to this location, the employees have been friendly and attentive. The last time I was there, the waiter was overly friendly but I guess that&#39;s better than being rude. <br><br>They have such a large variety of foods from Asian dishes to Mexican and even comfort food like meatloaf &amp; shepherd&#39;s pie. Yum- meatloaf!!<br> <br>And their cheesecake! Delish! Love the fresh strawberry and the vanilla bean! I wish we had a Cheesecake Factory where I lived!

I waited in line for over 30 minutes just to put my name down on the waiting list. Only to find out that it was a 5 HOUR wait for a party of 8. I NEVER should have needed to wait that long to put our name on the list. There were PLENTY of open tables and the party of 4 in front of me was told 15 minutes yet the manager wouldn&#39;t apologize or do anything to accommodate our party. We usually like the restaurant and have been often but we will not return
The service here is beyond poor. Trying to leave, let alone get food is unbelievably slow. If you don&#39;t have an entire afternoon to devote to mediocre food, go somewhere else.

When ever I want to treat myself or someone in my family to a great dinner out we go to the Cheesecake Factory! I&#39;m amazed that they can offer such an extensive menu and everything I&#39;ve ever gotten there has been wonderful. We always get cheesecake for dessert and I&#39;ve learned when in doubt, get the Godiva! It&#39;s a 40 minute drive for us but so worth it.

Been here several times and have had very good experiences. Our waiter Sean is awesome, always making solid recommendations and even highlighting good local spots to check out. We once had an issue where two of our free cheesecake coupons came back as invalid for some reason. The manager Brian waived it and comped us two cheesecakes without any challenge.

When it comes to chain restaurants, The Cheesecake Factory is in my top 5.<br><br>It&#39;s clean, the servers are attentive and efficient, and the menu is always exciting with each visit (I mean, come on, there is almost 10 pages)!<br><br>I&#39;m also always super impressed with the servers, and how they maintain CLEAN and SPOTLESS white uniforms - props, Cheesecake staff!<br><br>My favorite entree is the Chicken Madeira. My favorite cheesecake is the Lemon Raspberry.<br><br>Parking is a PAIN for this location (same with Polaris), but I deal with it.

I fucking love cake. <br>I will do a lot of shit for cake. <br>It&#39;s the only reason and the best part of braving polar temperatures and snow monsters, bearing hordes of white people who can neither parallel park nor be successful pedestrians (by successful, I mean, behaving in crosswalks in a way suggesting one chooses life), eventually just leaving your car wherever because &#34;officer, frankly, I am feeling rather handicapped, yes. Also, I&#39;ve no loose change&#34;, shoving your way past all the assholes who can find no other place to loiter in the restaurant lobby of the Cheesecake Factory but in the clearly marked ROPED OFF line for desserts and carryout, watching as a gainfully employed young black man slices a curiously small $10 piece of cake and proceeds to manhandle said piece like it&#39;s meatloaf, and you&#39;ll notice this started with &#34;the best part&#34; and you&#39;ll notice I can&#39;t finish the sentence because what the FUCK. <br>I never want to watch someone PALM a piece of cake, MY piece, like it&#39;s a motherfucking steak; and when I say no whipped cream, I never want anyone to roll their eyes and attempt to scrape the whipped cream off of the palmed piece of cake; and I never want to have to say &#34;NO THAT&#39;S NOT A THING CUT ANOTHER PIECE YOU ARE THE REASON WE CAN&#39;T HAVE NICE THINGS&#34;; and I never want to start having symptoms of a rage stroke in a motherfucking Cheesecake Factory lobby as I watch the same asshole cut a new smaller piece (BECAUSE IT&#39;S EASIER TO PALM, I ASSUME) and all without ever changing gloves. <br>Please promptly message me if you can direct me to a place where I might address the increasing urgency of my carrot cake needs because I don&#39;t know what in the living fuck that nonsense last night was but the devil is a lie. <br><br>#THESTRUGGLE

THE GOOD: The food was good, as it always is. Their portions are typically large but I opted for the lunch menu so it was appropriately sized. The cheesecake was excellent, as expected. <br><br>THE BAD: Took us forever to be seated, the food took a while and even getting water took at least 15 minutes. The worse has got to be the service - our server was horrible. I suppose he was having a bad day but I&#39;d would have rather he didn&#39;t take it out on us. He threw the menus down, he threw the glasses of water causing it to spill and just had a sour disposition all together. He would even slightly throw out food when they arrived. This restaurant would be 5-star worthy if not for the server. <br><br>OVERALL: I personally won&#39;t be returning anytime soon.

Favorite restaurant EVER! Have not had one bad thing here. Service is always great and fast. The burgers here are also the best burgers I&#39;ve ever had in my entire life! I&#39;ve had burgers from the top steak places and none of them can even come close to being as mouth watering as theirs. Love this place!

Great place with good food. The cheesecake is the real star though. You can look at all of the pies for sale as soon as you walk in. There&#39;s always a wait so make sure to give yourself some extra time This is a chain restaurant so you know it&#39;s going to be the same across the board.

we&#39;ve been waiting for your food for over an hour! didn&#39;t have to wait to be seated. Ordered an appetizer for my entree and took 20 minutes to get after everyone received their food. Beyond disappointed, management did not even care.
There was a bit of a wait, but once we were seated we were served right away. Got the avocado rolls, they we great. Definitely recommend.
Food was extremely salty. Terrible service. Will not be coming back! Way overpriced for what it is!
Great food but service was extremely slow.  We waited 15 minutes to order and another hour to get our food- 3 salads and 5 kids meals.  No explanation or apology for slow service.

A 10 minute wait at 7:00pm on a Friday in Easton?!? That&#39;s worth 4 stars alone. <br><br>That was the wait length for seating inside and outside. We wanted outside so we could enjoy the beautiful weather and people watch the Easton Art Festival goers. We got exactly what we wanted. With an excellent waiter and cocktails to boot. <br><br>I had the chicken parm sandwich which was pretty tasty. The boyfriend had the luau salad which was massive and incredibly good. And, when I say massive, I meant it... it was 3 stories high. For drinks, I skipped the wine and went with J.W.&#39;s pink lemonade which tasted exactly like pink lemonade despite being entirely alcohol. I don&#39;t remember the name of the drink my bf had but it was tropical and wonderful. No cheesecake on this visit but I pressed my face against the case so I know what I am having for dinner next time.

The wait to get a table takes a long time. Staff pleasant, delicious food, the pumpernickel bread is amazing! Menu is huge. Their vegetable salad is incredible, portions are huge. They have a skinny menu which is delicious. Cheesecake good, but rich. I can only eat a few bites and usually share with someone. Decor beautiful.

I hadn&#39;t been here in quite a while so I decided to come over tonight for dinner.  My biggest problem was 1) finding it. and 2) getting back to it after looking for a parking space.  But I managed to do both.  Finding a seat has never been a problem for me since I&#39;ve always been content to eat at the bar and that&#39;s what I did tonight.  And they were CROWDED!!  <br><br>But I sat at the bar and ordered a number of small plates.  I got the corn fritters (these were the best of the bunch), the beets and goat cheese, and the small house salad.  For dessert I got a piece of cheesecake to bring home and I haven&#39;t been hungry enough to even look at it yet.<br><br>The small house salad would have been plenty large for me under any conditons and the beets, well, there could have been a few more of them.  But it was a good meal and I&#39;ll likely go back again.

I went to Cheesecake Factory just for dessert.  Though it was very busy, we were able to get a table for two at 9pm on a Saturday night in about 5 minutes.  We already knew exactly what we wanted to order but we had to wait at least 10 minutes for our server to come.  <br><br>There were many more tempting options than the last time we were there - I ended up getting the smores cheesecake and it was incredible.  There were small chunks of chocolate and a toasted marshmallow on top - a very accurate take on a smore.  <br><br>Different people tried bringing other tables&#39; dinners to us 2-3 times - one time while we were in the middle of eating our dessert (try and use some common sense).  <br><br>Overall, the cheesecake is amazing.  The restaurant could benefit from better organization.  I would have just got my cheesecake to go and sat outside by the fountains but it was raining.

You can&#39;t go wrong at the Cheese Cake Factory, I mean the name just makes you hungry. My family and I was able to go out for brunch and I enjoyed the make your own omelet and it was delicious. My wife got the Eggs Benedict. <br>Great service too, waitress was very helpful and took the time to answer any questions we had about the menu. <br>We will defiantly come back for a return visit.
I love eating in Cheesecake factory because the quality and taste of food,  yet, today the restaurant fails to deliver good service which I noticed to be the case during busy times!

Not thrilled. Quility of food is not represented by the high prices. My $15 fish tacos should have been $7. Same for my husband and daughters meals. Over priced for not great food. Not surprised though anybody with that many items on there menu usually don&#39;t hit the mark on all of it. There known for cheesecake so that&#39;s all they should do.

Menu full of nothing I like<br><br>  For such a large menu, I can never find anything that I like from Cheesecake.  It is just not good to me.  I don&#39;t eat cheesecake either, and the desserts I have had weren&#39;t very good.  Maybe next time, sike there won&#39;t be a next time.

Great location.  Size is a little small when it comes to the wait.  I have had to wait outside during the winter because there was no more room on the inside.  Great food, large portions.  Always stick with the classic cheesecake.

They were out of several dishes our party of 9 tried to order last evening.  All salmon dishes and shrimp platters. That was disappointing but mostly that they did not tell the people who ordered the shrimp platters they did not have them until right when everyone else was receiving their food. So these people had to wait for the new food to be made. While we ate. They got their food much later. Nothing was offered to them. We had to ask. When we did and the manager came. He was surprised no one had told him much earlier so he could have handled. Food was good but they handled the situation poorly.

Food was good but overpriced.  Our server, Charles, acted annoyed the whole time with our family of three.  He didn&#39;t even bag our food but bagged the table next to us.  I am sure we won&#39;t be frequenting this establishment.

I&#39;ve only dined-in a couple of times and I&#39;ve had good food.  They are always very busy.  I especially like the Avocado Eggrolls on the appetizer menu, which are to-die-for.  If I am at Easton (which is not often at all because I hate people) I will get them as carryout.  One of my favorite dishes ever.

I really do like their food, and of course cheesecake, but they lose a star for the  dreadful wait. I know it&#39;s great to be busy, but I hate waiting forever and then having to swim my way through a stupid busy sea of people and tables and chairs to get to where I&#39;m going. <br>I did visit once on a Monday morning I believe? It was pretty slow, and THAT was nice. So maybe I should only go on weekday mornings or afternoons.

Not one to write reviews (for anything) but felt compelled to write this one. Came at 4:15 today and was asked to wait 15 min with a wide open restaurant. We literally passed empty booth after empty booth while walking to our seats ... Upon arrival, our booth was layered with crumbs and our dish ware was stained and crusted. We were so disgusted that we looked at each other and without saying anything just walked out. Thanks for taking 20 min of my Friday evening and reminding me why I hate corporate restaurants. Please fail soon

Got lucky to find two seats right away at the bar for dinner with my wife. Overall a great experience. Drinks were sizable and tasty and served quickly as was our food and all refills thanks to Matthew. Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp was well prepared and served around a giant mound of rice - plenty enough to have leftovers for lunch tomorrow. My go-to Veggie Burger with an excellent side salad hit the spot as usual. It falls apart a little too easily but is just as delicious when eaten with a fork and knife. It&#39;s even better when I add mustard or hot sauce. It may not always be worth the long wait (1 hour or more) but it consistently makes for a great experience, especially when the entire family goes and has so many options.

This was an extremely bad experience for me and my family, especially since we were coming here for a couple of birthdays. I concede that it was very busy at the time but we waited over an hour for our food and all the dishes were cold by the time we got them. I&#39;m trying not to blame the waiter (who&#39;s name I did not get), but he did not offer any excuse as to why our food was late or why they were all cold. And it especially didn&#39;t help when he almost put his tie into my food several times when he was trying to refill some waters at our table. I&#39;ve had decent experiences here before but we spent about an hour and a half from being seated to getting our food. This will most likely be my last time I go here and I can&#39;t recommend anyone going here for a larger party because you will be waiting for an extremely long time.

I&#39;m not a huge fan as I think their menu is just a little overwhelming and nothing stands out or is exemplary.  I had the chicken katsu this time and it was rather tasty. However the 1900 calorie count was a bit of a sticker shock.  They are a solid restaurant but I&#39;m more a mom and pop type of guy.  Now the cheesecake is rather unique and delish.  Overall a little pricey but enough variety that just about anyone can find something to dine on.

Stopped for a late lunch with wife. We were seated immediately and approached within a minute by server. He was a very happy and knowledgeable young man. After a few suggestions we ordered the potstickers as an app as well as asian lettuce wraps and turkey avocado sandwich. All items delivered in a timely manner, presented well and tasted delicious. We finished the meal with a lemon meringue cheesecake and coffee. What could be better. This location never disappoints.

Love love love the smokehouse bbq burger.  This is our go_to place for gurlie gatherings.  The brown bread loaf is the best. White vested waiters leave you feeling pampered.  Prices are on the high end which is why we save this for special gatherings.  Expect $50 for 2 if ur going for the dessert (and who isnt?) Plus $10 tip.  Worth it occasionally !

20 minutes 20 more minutes after 20 minutes. Management.... as a consumer I do not ask how long as a formality I ask how long the wait is to see if I want to wait for your services...... very poor customer service.

I been basly ALL The Cheesecake Factory! This place is AWESOME! Its abit price in some things! They just open a pice colser where I live in FL and LORD there was one  hell of a line! Then there was 2nd line FULL of SENIORS! Come EARLY to any these store near by you! The food is OUTSTANDING but the lines are a BARE!<br><br>Some these store DO caters other not! You may need to ask hold a table for you with a small nice fee!

Went to Cheesecake Factory because we had a gift card. It was OK, but not great. Had either the food or service been better, they likely would have gotten 3 stars. <br><br>First issue, we waited more than 20 minutes for our appetizer. Then, our entrees came before we had finished the appetizer. <br><br>Our buffalo blasts appetizer was pretty good, but could have used a bit more spice. I had the &#34;spicy&#34; chicken tacos for my entree. It was not spicy, was pretty much tasteless and was dry. The biggest taste I got was from the tortilla, instead of everything in it. <br><br>Next issue was with the service. Our waitress was friendly and nice, but I think she had too many tables. We were both completely out of water. She stopped to check on the food and mentioned she would get more, but it never came. <br><br>The best part of the meal was the cheesecake. I got the pumpkin cheesecake, and it was delicious. We also finally got some more water- we asked for it when our cheesecake was delivered. <br><br>Not terrible, but I&#39;m glad I didn&#39;t pay for most of the meal. Probably won&#39;t go back for dinner.

Went to the Cheesecake Factory at the Greene in Dayton and it was the worst experience. My waitress dumped 5 drinks on me and ran off to the kitchen never came back out to say sorry. The manager moved us to a different table and apologized for her.after all of that all I got was one free piece of cheesecake.

We had read previous reviews and thought we&#39;d try it out this past Sunday afternoon.  The place was packed, but because we were just a twosome we were seated immediately.  The seating is what I call picnic style.  You are  essentially sharing a table with strangers.<br><br>I ordered a Swiss/ mushroom burger that came with fries, and the wife got a pecan covered French Toast dish with bacon.  The food wasn&#39;t bad - average, a bit pricy ($12.50 for the burger &amp; fries), decent atmosphere if you love crowds, and slightly above average service.  We didn&#39;t try the cheesecake but it sure looked good.  I felt like the whole experience was kind of &#34;yuppy&#34;, but hey we were in that kind of area.  Will we go back?  For the price and type of food available here, probably not.  There are to many other choices in this area of Columbus.
On a Saturday afternoon at 3,  we waited 52 minutes for a seat,  and then another 30 minutes for food.  No wonder the wait to be seated was so long! The waitress was passable. The food was good.

Food was great. The steak diane and shrimp scampi are delicious and well prepared as well as the buffalo bites and stuffed  mushrooms. We were looking forward to drinks, dinner,and cheesecake to celebrate a birthday. After waiting an hour to get seated (no big deal,they were super busy) we had what may be the worst service I&#39;ve received by Adalina. We ordered appetizers and our meals which were both delivered quickly by the food runners. Our waitress was at our table only when taking our order, when the food was delivered, and when we finally flagged her down 20 minutes after everyone was done eating. One of the guests at our table went his entire meal without anything to drink. We told her he never got his second beer (he had ordered when the food arrived)to which she responded &#34;Oh okay&#34; and then proceeded to inform us she had been taking care of a tables order with a food allergy. Apparently it&#39;s ok to neglect your other tables if someone is allergic to something. Everyone had planned to order cheesecake but chose not to considering how long it took for Adalina to return to her tables. It took another 10 minutes to get the checks and when they were brought she made sure to inform us she had taken off that second beer you know the one we never received. Really disappointed.
Yum - the cheesecake factory<br>Awesome menu - Consistently good food, service, and atmosphere.<br>Same here as the other ones I have been to.

First time going to this restaurant and i must say everything was delicious except for the customer service. Our server was beyond rude, he couldn&#39;t recommend anything on the menu and then he did not attend to us like he did the a table that was right next to us. Im completely unsatisfied with the service but I can say the food was on point. Next time i&#39;ll have to just order out to enjoy my meal completely.
Whatever. Too any choices on the menu (do something good and stick to that, not try and have it all), too expensive, so-so service, why go? Ugh.

Horrible brunch! He ordered blueberry pancakes, I ordered a spinach,bacon,mushroom omelet w fruit. Fruit looked and tasted canned and there were only a few pieces in little bowl. Omelet was cold. Mentioned this to server Carla, she took omelet &amp; fruit back. Fruit came back with frozen blueberries dumped over it...gross! He was done with his pancakes by the time I got my 2nd omelet. Had no flavor, totally unseasoned, inedible. Mentioned this to Carla, she said &#34;sorry!&#34; and waled away. Rip off for $14.00 meal, never again!
It was really good I got the burrito it was really good then for cheese cake I got the taremisu sorry for my spelling not sure how to spell that but anyway it was really good service too

Every once in a while I review a place and I look at the star rating and I go &#39;huh..I really don&#39;t know&#39; and then you weigh the pros and the cons. I had this issue with this place.<br><br>I LOVE this place but this location wasn&#39;t as good as what I remember back east. The wait at 6pm was an hour and half so we walked over to barnes and noble and browsed, which is always nice for a mall restaurant... there&#39;s distractions. When our names were called we noticed the wait went up to 3 hours. THAT IS NUTS!!! I don&#39;t care how good the cheesecake is, 3 hours is NUTS!! <br><br>So we get in at about 7:30 and our waitress took a considerable amount of time to get to us and was in a rush the whole night, often forgetting we asked for things like napkins or more bread. She needed a break to say the least....badly! The bread that was on the table was stale; like 2 days ago type stale. For an app we all shared the buffalo blasts (Chicken, Cheese and Our Spicy Buffalo Sauce all Stuffed in a Spiced Wrapper and Fried until Crisp. Served with Celery Sticks and Blue Cheese Dressing) which was tasty... a lot tastier then I thought they would be. The dipping sauce was bad though. They didn&#39;t go together at all. <br><br>I ordered the chicken romano (Breast of Chicken Coated with a Romano-Parmesan Cheese Crust. Served with Pasta w/ Tomato Sauce.)  It was 2 flattened pieces of dried out chicken with panko bread crumbs (tasted no cheese) with a huge (like 4 servings) of pasta with a creamy red sauce. The sauce was good but there was barely any at all on the pasta and the chicken was drier then a boot so I asked for more sauce not wanting to send the food back; it took long enough to get to us the first time. The hubby got some kind of pasta and had the same issue I did; didn&#39;t realize what he was ordering and it came out dry and without much sauce. We both asked for more sauce which came out quick. <br>Dad got a salad which was large, but not enough food for a man in his eyes.
