He didn&#39;t say much else about it apart from complaining about prices for bad food. My mom order mac and cheese, which came out deep fried. She was horrified by the calories but her face showed she was in heaven. <br><br>The reason we go back is the cheesecake. I got the red velvet cheese cake this time. My favorite so far, although their blueberry cheese cake is so heavenly that I may have two favorites. Then again, every new flavor I try ends up being my new favorite so oh well. Mom got a huge piece of carrot cake and dam near licked the plate clean. I think next time I&#39;ll just go back for apps and cheesecake.

The Cheesecake Factory at Easton is ALWAYS packed, but I don&#39;t mind because the food is amazing. The servers are very attentive and always extremely grateful when you leave a good tip. The bread is warm and soft. My favorite is the fried mac and cheese, but all of their pastas are great. I rarely have room left in my stomach for cheesecake, but it&#39;s worth the stomachache.

Best cheesecake ever!  Good food, but a bit pricey!  The best thing is their cheesecake and the many different flavors of cheesecake!  Best cheesecake in the world!  I personally love the plain cheesecake with fruit on top but the other kinds are also delicious!!!

I have eaten at this easton cheesecake factory many times- and each time we had great service until last night. I have been a server for the past 5 years, so I know when another server says the same B.S lines to me and I know they messed up. I understand that mistakes happen, things in the kitchen can get crazy, people run food they weren&#39;t suppose to. <br>i get it. But our server never apologized during the meal and neither did management. <br>it took almost 10 minutes- once again if she would have apologized in her greet &#34;thank you so much for your patience this evening I&#39;m Tianna&#34;- i get it. full section. running around.<br>nothing. <br>It took quiet awhile after that to receive our drinks...1 ice water and 3 unsweetened ice teas.  *do the servers/management at cheesecake factory not help one another when they are slammed?*  when she finally came back to us we gave her our full order- apps and all. <br>this is where the service and management failed. <br>Our appetizers never came because our entree&#39;s came out first. two other servers ran our dinner out in which we asked what happened to our appetizers. They were being plated. Our server didn&#39;t come over to say &#34;I am so sorry!&#34; nadda. The manager who I assume was running the line that evening came over right when our food was dropped off to inform us that our appetizers were coming out, in which we said no. we had our dinner. no thanks. He honestly didn&#39;t looked surprised that she messed up. But no apology just a &#34;I&#39;ll take those off the check for you&#34; and walked away. <br>we were half way done with our meal when our server came back to see how everything was tasting-no mention of the appetizers mix up. dropped off the bread that we had asked for when we ordered our food over 20 minutes prior....filled up drinks and walked away and didn&#39;t come back until we boxed up our food. <br>we all ordered a cheesecake, my boyfriend a cup of coffee. My friends across from me said &#34;yes, two pumpkin cheesecakes because we don&#39;t share&#34;- she misunderstood, this I wasn&#39;t as mad because I once again understand that it&#39;s loud and the other cheesecake came out somewhat quicker *I understand you have to rush the order* - since only three cheesecakes came out not 4.<br>but my boyfriend never got his coffee. no apology. <br>so we paid and hung out in the booth- we were actually ok with how everything happened for our meals. we haven&#39;t see each other and it was actually my friends taking me and my boyfriend out as my boyfriends belated birthday present to us from them. well needless to say...<br>I caught our server and another server at a terminal staring at us- I can only speculate that they were sh** talking us because she saw her 10% tip, but they made it pretty obvious, my jaw dropped. Go to the back ladies. <br>Our server did apologize once though- at the end after we paid about the appetizers but it wasn&#39;t sincere, quick, and she promptly walked away. <br>I was just going to write this off as one bad trip, as I&#39;ve gone before and my service was great- I wasn&#39;t going to write a review but the last straw was when our server came back to us to ask us why she received such a bad tip..which is that cheesecake factory policy? because...it should have been obvious- well my friend that paid went on to explain why she received a bad tip- about how the appetizers, the coffee- she tried to say she can&#39;t control when the food comes out- which is somewhat true-but in this circumstance no. I don&#39;t know if you use micros or aloha but any server knows not to put appetizers and pasta in at the same time- as most places you have the pasta pre-cooked so all you have to do is deep fry the chicken, toss in the sauce and plate them- so yeah they cook way faster than all of the appetizers we ordered. She either put them in at the same time or  way too close to one another- like she rang them in less then five minutes later. Management never came back either to check on us.<br>honestly we could have solved this problem if management would have been better and expressed ANY apologies but none. I hope next time I go back this issues will be resolved with service and management.

Great pasta!  Excellent servers!  Love going here.  I do think for the price of the pasta dishes a salad should be included.  Haven&#39;t had anything but the Pasta but it is delicious.  The décor is a little cheesy but nice.

The first time I tried the Cheesecake Factory I ordered something called the California Guacamole and Brie melt and it was life-changing.  Hand to heaven it was one of the best foods I&#39;ve ever tried in my life.  And then they got rid of it.  So Cheesecake Factory and I stopped being friends.<br><br>But it&#39;s one of those breakups, where we still run into each other now and then.  Inevitably someone from back home will be coming to Columbus and insist we eat there and I&#39;ll smile and agree, and enjoy the complimentary bread, which is really quite good, but then I&#39;ll take one look at the menu and remember why the Cheesecake Factory and I are no longer on speaking terms.<br><br>For such a long menu, they have very little that appeals to me.  I eat meat, but only when I&#39;m sure of the quality, and since I&#39;m not sure of it at CF that leaves me with the veggie options, and the veggie options get no love from me.<br><br>The cheesecake is good, the waits are annoying, and a visit once a year seems like enough.  I&#39;m giving them three stars for the bread and the dessert, but everything in between is meh at best.

I love Cheesecake Factory, and especially the one at Easton. We always get great service there and the waiters and waitresses spend the perfect amount of time at the table. Some restaurants you get annoyed by constantly getting asked if everything is okay, or sometimes they don&#39;t come to your table quite enough. Every time we are at Easton they stop by and fill drinks and I sometimes don&#39;t even realize it. Maybe one or two stops by the table making sure everything is okay. It&#39;s very nice! Can actually enjoy my dinner and have conversations without interruptions every 5/10 minutes, but still have full drinks and see them walk by if we need to stop them. <br><br>Not to mention their food is to die for. Haven&#39;t had one thing yet that I don&#39;t like from any Cheesecake Factory!

Tried to call an order for cheesecake  pick up was put on hold for seven minutes with no answer so I walked into the store. Spoke to Michael D in bakery who then said that there wasn&#39;t any call transferred to him for a cheesecake order and was also informed that they do not do carry out order for cheesecake over the phone. Michael D then took our order, never got an apology for being put on hold or misinformed. Very poor customer service.

There was no wait at 5 pm on a Wednesday!  Service was good but hard to hear with the loudness of the music.  Had the skinnyliciousness tacos with chicken, pretty good!  The Cuban is what my boyfriend ordered.  It was very tasty.  I would definitely come back again.

OK, it seems like you have seem one Cheesecake Factory you have seem them all.  The interior may be different, but the concept is the same.  My experience with this part of the chain was to help my very pregnant friend satisfy a craving.  We (her husband and I) ran in, waited in line, placed our order and got back to the car in 5 minutes.  Yeah!!! for the Low Carb Cheesecake with Strawberries and Bananas.  (Did I really say yeah for Bananas???? I guess that shows how much I treasure my friend, that I even cheer for bananas when they satisfy my friend&#39;s cravings.)<br><br>It was very easy to order desert for take out.   Kudos to the staff for great service!!!

While the wait was over an hour saturday evening the meal was worth the wait.  What I enjoy most about CF is that there is something on the menu for everyone.  <br>I had the Petit Filet and it was very tender and cooked perfectly.  My father really liked his fish tacos, my husband was disappointed in the Ahi Tuna, but realized he shouldn&#39;t have expected sushi grade at this restaurant.  My Aunt loved the Factory Chopped Salad, which is my usual...best salad on the menu - page 9.<br>My Passion Fruit Mojitos were not too strong, and not too weak. <br><br>Our server was excellent and as busy as it was he took the time to answer all of our questions, make great suggestions, and keep our glasses filled.  <br><br>This is an excellent choice if going out with a large group or people with varying tastes.  And don&#39;t forget to order the cheesecake, it is really good.  The strawberry is my favorite, my parents love the Chocolate Mousse.  <br><br>I&#39;ve also ordered their cheesecakes online for birthdays and they arrive fresh!

Here are the top six things you should know before visiting The Cheesecake Factory in Easton (or any Cheesecake Factory, really):<br><br>1.) This place is always seems to be pretty busy, but I can&#39;t seem to understand why. My excuse was that I had a gift certificate, but I imagine most people are choosing to send their dining dollars to Cheesecake Factory over one of the local great restaurants they could discover through Yelp.<br>2.) They&#39;re obviously known for their large portions, and the food is actually pretty good, but everything tastes good when it&#39;s made with two sticks of butter and topped with cheddar cheese. The menu is also very large, which would be good if you&#39;re with a bunch of picky eaters, but it was honestly a bit overwhelming and hard to figure out which items would be the best choices.<br>3.) The decor in this place seems to be having some identity issues. There seemed to be Mediterranean, Egyptian, Italian, French, and possibly Jersey Shore influence in the design. Again, it seems like they&#39;re trying to have as many concepts as possible to please everyone, but it just comes off strange and identity-less.<br>4.) The prices are a little high, but I guess many find comfort knowing that they are going to get a decent meal and plenty of leftovers.<br>5.) The service is pretty good. No complaints from my visit. <br>6.) By the end of our meal we were stuffed, but since it&#39;s The Cheesecake Factory, we felt obligated to get a slice (plus cheesecake is delicious). We got a piece of chocolate mousse cheesecake to go and it tasted great. For being called The Cheesecake Factory, that does seem to be where their strength is. If I had a craving I could see myself stopping back in to get a slice, but I wouldn&#39;t come back for the rest of the menu.<br><br>Got your six,<br>Neal

Taste: 3<br>Value: 5<br>Service: 4<br><br>Since it was the pre-anniversary and they had a special, I decided to drop here after eating at Brio. Huge mistake. I was completely full after Brio, and I was so stuffed after eating a slice of cheesecake it almost hurt to walk around. Interestingly enough, this was actually my first time at a Cheesecake Factory chain.<br><br>Quality-wise, it&#39;s pretty good. I ordered the Fresh Strawberry, which came with a ton of whipped cream and 3-4 strawberries. However, I wasn&#39;t amazed by it, hence no 4-star rating. They also took nearly 10 minutes to find a seat for me, even though it was just for one. Afterwards, I felt a bit guilty dropping in for just cheesecake, so I gave my waitress a nice tip.

Ten tragedies. The Cheesecake Factory at this location has been going downhill for a while now. Today just took the cake. It took forever to get us seated. We had to get up and ask for a high chair for our son. I ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, sans chicken, sub shrimp. It came out and the shrimp weren&#39;t cleaned properly, and the sauce was like water. It was ridiculous. I know it was Sunday afternoon. I realize that we were seated during a shift change. But there was really no excuse for the subpar food. I ended up sending it back and gnoshed on some of my guy&#39;s fries. Disappointing.

I love this place...their food is delicious and their cheesecakes even more so, they are AMAZING!  The only complaint is that there are so many calories in this so I only eat half of the slice and save the rest for the next day so that I can actually eat part of a meal.  Next time I&#39;m having them cut it in half and put half in  to-go box since its sooo hard to be self disciplined lol

Ordered a cheesecake on Friday night to pick up Monday at 5:00. I think that&#39;s a fair notice. I left work early to pick it up and it wasn&#39;t ready- which ended up being fine since they had extra in the back. I also ordered a chocolate block on the side to read &#34;happy birthday brian&#34;. I kid you not it took the red headed baker 30 minutes to write on it. She had one that would have been fine. It was sloppy but I would have taken it. But no, she wiped the writing off and started over. I only put 20 minutes in my meter thinking I&#39;d be in and out to pick up my order. So I told them I had to pay my meter and I&#39;d be back. I came back and she was starting over on a whole new chocolate block. I mean come on. So I waited another 10 minutes and then said &#34;look forget about the chocolate block&#34;. Took my cake and left. I&#39;m pretty upset actually. I paid for that block and tipped the bakers before any of this and I 100% regret it. It&#39;d be one thing if hey were just running behind schedule but if the new girl takes more than 4 attempts at writing &#34;happy birthday brian&#34; on a block then for the love of god take pity on the customer and help her out. Wasted money. The cake was fine but I won&#39;t be coming back to that location again.

Our family a party of 5 went to this resturant to celebrate out daughters 20th birthday. After Looking over the menu and talking we realized that 30 minutes had passed and we did not have a server. I stopped a passing server who said she did not know who our server was, that she would check . When she returned she said she did not know who it was  but would take our drink order. She did that and our appetizer order. Meanwhile I stopped a hostess and asked who was our server and told her how long we have been waiting. She said she would check, she came to our table a short while later said Nathan was our server and he would be with us shortly. He never came, but the server who took our initial order delivered an appetizer and said she would take care of us.meanwhile people all around us were being seated and served.  I asked the hostess for the manager, who arrived and was apologetic and would take care of our appetizer. Our food was slow to come, but tasty as usual. When our check came the appetizer was still on our check. I told the server about the error, she had to check with the manager. That was an awful evening . Never should a customer have to chase down for a server!

I felt morally obligated to update this review because of a change in my diet. In my previous review, I described the world&#39;s most amazing sandwich, known as the Navajo. -  Warm, crunchy fry bread. Perfectly ripened avocado. Grilled chicken. Lettuce. Tomato. Herb mayo. Served with amazing french fries, and the most incredibly rich ranch dressing to dunk them in.<br><br>Well... I don&#39;t eat MEAT anymore, so when I was at Cheesecake Factory the other day, it physically pained me to know that I couldn&#39;t eat this sandwich. I made a last-minute decision when the waitress arrived back at our table - I asked for the Navajo, with no chicken, and added swiss cheese and mushrooms (and the obligatory side of ranch.) She only hesitated for a fraction of a second at me ordering a chicken sandwich sans chicken, then smiled and said &#34;Of course!&#34; <br><br>When my Navajo came out, it was PACKED with veggies so that it was just as fulfilling as if it had chicken. And, if possible... even better than I remembered it. :)

Just went here for a few drinks after walking around Easton. The martinis were tasty and the people watching was very entertaining. The best recommendation I have for any Cheesecake Factory is come with the mindset to wait- because it&#39;s going to be a while.

Huge menu.  I got the lunch size of the Cobb salad and it was HUGE.  No clue what the full sized portion would be.  Everyone loved their entrees and then on to the cheesecake.   <br><br>Lots of choices here too.  I am a big Key Lime Pie fan, so I got their cheesecake version of that.  I highly recommend.

The place was packed for Valentine&#39;s day. Despite that fact, there were plenty of servers, and we didnt have to wait long for anything. our waitress was very sweet, and did an adequate job. The food was amazing. I had the Chicken Di Pana. Delicious! If there weren&#39;t so many places to eat in Columbus, I&#39;d be back again today.

I always enjoying going to the Cheesecake Factory! The warming environment in the restaurant makes me and my partner relief! Their pasta, especially Pasta Da Vinchi is fabulous! It has the taste which you will never get tired of. The sauce and the ingredients also put the pasta to a better space! This is a recommended restaurant for any occasion! Definitely try their cheesecakes out to!

I&#39;ve eaten in house a few times, but mostly takeout.. just for the reason that it was so packed that I didn&#39;t want to wait 2 hours for a table. This is just one of those restaurants that reviews really don&#39;t matter because people will go there anyway.. <br>They&#39;ll go just for the sake of going because it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory. <br>There&#39;s nothing wrong with that- CF has built such a reputation that they have become &#34;review-proof&#34; in a way. <br><br>The service is decent, but it&#39;s clearly obvious that the servers make their money on quantity, not quality- a direct opposition from the Fish Market.. CF service has the turn em and burn em approach and it&#39;s sad. <br><br>There menu is such a novel that it would be hard to find something even the pickiest eater didn&#39;t like.  <br><br>At CF, it&#39;s easy to make an appetizer a meal because the portions are huge...  beyond huge. The price is definitely in line with the portion sizes. <br><br>Their takeout leaves a little to be desired, but it&#39;s not the food-  it&#39;s the accuracy...

Quoted 30 minutes waited 45-50 minutes.  Seated and greeted. Order app and meal. <br>Food took FOREVR! Our food came out before kids. Husband food cold. Ordered cheesecake and after 25 min waiting for it finally got up to find a manager. 3 hrs later we were finally out of there.

We LOVE the Cheesecake Factory. Have been to them from Hawaii to Florida, but THIS ONE IS SO SLOW AND INEFFICIENT for some reason. We have gone here repeatedly and it is ALWAYS the same-SLOW and they get the orders WRONG

I ordered a ribeye.  The good news:  I ordered it medium rare and it was prepared properly.  The bad news:  It was way too salty.  I&#39;m not sure if it was the sauce--seemed like a wine sauce or demi-glace of some type, or it was some type of rub they prepped it with, but whatever they doused it in spoiled the taste of an otherwise perfectly prepared cut of meat.  The mashed potatoes, bread and salad were good, but that does not offset the price of the meal.  For the price of the steak, comparable to restaurants for which steak is their specialty, it shouldn&#39;t taste like salt pork.

always a grand slam with a large group.  we each can order different items - chicken, pasta, asian, etc.  everything you could want!  we very much enjoy all of the options.  drinks are great and HUGE.  service was great.  our waiter was hysterical and quick with service and we were there!

Love it here! I have never been disappointed before with them and this past Sunday was excellent all around. Our server was fantastic, our pizza and salads were delicious, as well as our cheesecake and the fresh bread they bring to the table. Our server was very attentive and seemed to enjoy his job and be super friendly. Will return in the future for sure!!

Terrible lunch experience. Our team of 10 colleagues chose Cheesecake Factory for a noon send-off event because the venue can accommodate large groups. However, we had to wait nearly an hour to get seated, with only scant apologies from the manager. And although two complimentary appetizers were provided, our meals came very slowly and we had to rush to finish in order to get back for meetings. By the time we got out of there, with ice tea running down the pants of one of our group members because our waiter knocked over her glass, it was nearly 2:30 and our work day was shot. The manager adjusted the bill only when we brought attention to our frustration, and we were numb to his mumbled apologies by that time. I am never returning, I don&#39;t care what time of day.

I&#39;ll jump on the &#34;meh, Cheesecake Factory&#34; bandwagon.  I&#39;ve always found the food to be very satisfying, once I navigated through the huge menu.  The prices are a little high and the portions are huge, however, which means it&#39;s best if you plan from the start to take half of your food home.<br><br>Of course, even after half a meal here, you might not be able to fit the cheesecake in your belly.  But odds are you&#39;ll order it anyway, and it&#39;ll be delicious.  The pieces are also quite large, however, so it&#39;s best to share them.  In other words, everything at this restaurant is twice as big as it should be.<br><br>So, yeah, I like the food fine, but as others have said the place is huge and loud and frequently has an hour wait.  I&#39;d sooner go almost anywhere else at Easton - Restaurant Hama and Cafe Istanbul in particular are both very good and far, far less populated than Cheesecake Factory, PF Chang&#39;s, or California Pizza Kitchen usually are.

I&#39;ve always been a fan of the Cheesecake Factory, in Columbus, in Atlanta, and in any other city that I&#39;ve been too lol.  <br><br>I love the versatility of the menu!  I&#39;m world&#39;s pickiest eater &amp; seriously, they offer a little something for everyone!<br><br>As long as they continue to serve good food and for the most part have good customer service, I&#39;ll continue to be a Cheesecake Factory fan!

I was so disappointed with this restaurant.  Have been wanting to try it for years.  We were in Columbus for a few days and made a special trip to Easton Center to try it.  When we were being seated I asked for a booth and was told none were available.  I saw plenty open so I pointed this out to her.  She said those seated six people and since we only had three people we couldn&#39;t sit there.  I have a bad back and booths are generally more comfortable for me.  After we were seated I noticed parties with only two people being seated in the booths.  Wow... Really?  The food here was ok.. But definitely not worth being treated so rudely.  If I am going to drop $70 on a Monday afternoon for lunch I think I should be treated better by the staf

Why is this restaurant always crowded?  I&#39;m having difficulty thinking of a time I ate here or even walked past when the lobby wasn&#39;t packed shoulder-to-shoulder with people, spilling out onto the patio.  Sometimes you even have to get on a waiting list for a beeper!  People wait hours to eat here.  I don&#39;t get it.  I mean, the food is quite good, much better than average for a national chain, but it&#39;s not THAT good.  And waiting in that lobby is stressful.  There&#39;s a constant stream of servers running back and forth from the dining room to the case the holds the cheesecake, and there are very few places to sit.  They need to have a dedicated waiting room here, like a doctor&#39;s office.<br><br>I also hate the portion sizes here.  When you get a &#34;lunch-sized&#34; salad for your meal, and you eat until you&#39;re stuffed and the bowl is still three-quarters full, it&#39;s too much.  The serving sizes are big at many chain restaurants, but here they&#39;re out of control.  It&#39;s like the poster child for American gluttony.<br><br>All that said, the food here really is quite good.  With a name like Cheesecake Factory, your cheesecake better be awesome, and it is (you ever wonder why almost nothing at Olive Garden contains olives?).  I always settle on the banana cream, and it&#39;s good enough to daydream about.  As for entrees, I&#39;ve never had anything I disliked.  The best thing I&#39;ve ever had here is the pizza with goat cheese and roasted veggies.  It&#39;s very, very rare I order vegetarian dishes, but the description was so mouth-watering, I had to try it.  I don&#39;t know if they still serve cole slaw, but I hope so, because it&#39;s the only restaurant cole slaw I&#39;ve ever liked in my life... made with crisp, fresh cabbage and a light dressing.<br><br>I just wish you could eat here without wasting an hour of your life standing around.
A little overpriced. Portions are large but food isn&#39;t amazing.
Great place. Awesome interior ambiance, very extensive menu, and killer cheesecake.

I&#39;m a fan of Cheesecake Factories.  Unfortunately this location is packed on weekends.  We got to experience a 2 hour wait for a table.  Totally crazy, but since we were from out of town and with a group we were patient.  As always, food comes in large portions. FYI gratuity automatically added on with larger groups.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants. Because almost every dish have a good flavor and the amount of the food is really large. I love the brown bread before the dinner, which is very soft and savory. However,  the serve speed is not so good. Maybe there are too many big fans every day and the restaurant is always loud and full of people. But, it&#39;s worth to try the famous cheesecake. The cheese is vey light and not greasy. I&#39;d like to eat one there and take off another.

This place is great! If you&#39;ve never been to a Cheesecake Factory you have to go, it&#39;s an important life experience. The one in Easton is very nice. The decorations are kind of Egyptian meets Aztec-ish. The wait time varies. In the evenings on weekends, when Easton is packed, there is usually a 2 hour wait (and they do not take reservations). But if you go on off hours there is hardly any wait at all. The service can be either amazing or disappointing depending on how busy they are. But never mind the service, the food is always amazing! My favorite entree is the Teriyaki Chicken (which comes with grilled pineapple and bananas on the side - Yum). The Cheescake menu spans 2 pages and there are so many different types. But my favorite deserts on the menu are the Tiramisu and Original Cheesecake w/cherry topping.

Went to CCF yesterday with 4 other friends for lunch. Ordered an item that came with soup and salad. They only had one soup option, which I found to be odd. Then when I got home, the strawberry cheesecake that I got to go and paid 7.95 for was just a sliver... not at all worth that price. IF I ever go back to CCF, I will not order the cheesecake. Though it was good, not worth the price for such a small slice.
My food appeared to have been old .. Like sitting from an earlier cancelled order or something :( everyone else at the table liked there food.

Dear Cheesecake Factory,<br><br>Thank you for the chopped-up caterpillar--that was still wiggling nonetheless--the last time I ordered your Luau Salad. The fact that Twin discovered it as he was finishing up the salad for me was not at all comforting; it only led us to question ourselves as to who ate the other half of the caterpillar. Me or him? It&#39;s a great appetite killer, I tell ya. So yes, CF, I am now scarred for life and will never ever order salads anywhere else.<br><br>I realize that such insects are easily overlooked in green salad leaves and the like, but having one of them on display in my dish (and quite possibly moving its way to my stomach) is one hell of a different story... and a revolting one for that matter.<br><br>I have not been back ever since and will have to find other ways to satisfy my white chocolate macadamia nut cheesecake cravings. Sadness.<br><br>Sincerely,<br><br>A Former Faithful Customer
Just like every other Cheesecake Factory. Food was good. Service was good. The place was packed, but the wait wasn&#39;t too terrible.
Only go here for the cheesecake.  The actual food is blah-boring and greasy/salty/etc...
Love the portions and the variety in the menu.  Service is always top-notch and food is good as well.  Each plate will last you 2-3 meals which is nice to take home for leftovers.

This was my first time at the Cheesecake Factory and overall, it should get more than 5 stars. What a great place to come to for dinner. They have an extensive menu and you could pretty much find a little bit of everything on there from mexican to italian to good &#39;ol American food. We arrived last night (Saturday night) around 6 pm and we only had to wait 20 minutes for our table. We were seated quickly and the waitress was great. I asked her what she recommended, which was the Chicken Midiera. Yum with a capital Y! We also chose to get a piece of cheesecake. Unfortunately the Oreo cheesecake had been sold out already. (boo!), but we ended up having the chocolate mousse cheesecake. Yeah, didnt think there was any room for cheesecake, but there was!! Overall the atmosphere was pleasing and very nice. It almost felt like we were out of town on vacation to a nice casual restaurant. We&#39;ll definitely be going there again soon!

I had a nice experience here. 4 stars for:<br><br>1) Very friendly (but not annoying) workers! <br>I believe everyone on staff said &#34;Welcome,&#34; &#34;Good Afternoon,&#34; or &#34;Have a good day!&#34;<br><br>2) Accomodating waitress.<br> I got the raspberry lemonade- which is possibly my favorite drink in the world- and it was never even close to being empty- plus the sugar sprinkled along the rim of the glass (which is part of the drink&#39;s appeal for me) was always there. The waitress was also very kind and friendly but NOT fake.<br><br>3) The food was awesome<br>It was flavorful, delicious and piping hot (when appropriate). I left happily full. I&#39;ll rarely say no if someone suggests eating at the cheesecake factory.  <br><br>4) Fast service<br>I was there on a weekday afternoon and the place was fairly crowded with lunch-ers, yet everything came out to the table so quickly, the thought crossed my mind that maybe they had some wizards working back in the kitchen....<br><br>Overall a very pleasant experience. I would not be opposed to a repeat meal.

It is really nice. Not only the cheese cake but also the curry food. I love it! The second reason I love it is because of the location. It is in the heart of Easton. After shopping, we can have a good meal. But, there are always many people. I need wait long time.

Why is this place always busy? There is always a wait. I guess the tourists that flock to Easton must love it. Me? Not so much. The food is good, but overpriced and not really worth the wait. The portions are ridiculously huge and so is the menu. This means everyone can find something and you have lunch for the next day. The service is usually underwhelming. I usually go for a pasta dish or salad. In the summer they had delicious fried zucchini. The cheesecake, of course doesn&#39;t disappoint.

Awesome cheesecake. Way overpriced for cheesecake and the food. The seating is cramped. Your table spills into the other tables. You might as well be dining with strangers because they are so close to you that their elbows touch yours when you eat. The service is slow and there is always a wait for a table.

Holy crap, why are so many people willing to shell out big bucks for this place? Look, if someone else was paying, I would enjoy  it, but I went with a large gift card and still payed a lot. The food is good, and so is the service, but come on, nothing daring is going on here, it&#39;s a chain!

The food is fantastic! Our service was very good as well (at least from the server). Getting a drink at the bar took 20 minutes though, and they weren&#39;t overly busy. Bartender paid attention only to the people sitting at the bar and didn&#39;t acknowledge those waiting for drinks who couldn&#39;t sit.  This restaurant is very busy all the time and our &#34;40 minute&#34; wait time ended up being about 60 minutes. This is a good place to eat during off-peak times.

Personal biases of mine that impact my review of this restaurant:<br><br>I try to avoid Easton like the plague.<br>I&#39;m a vegetarian.<br>I prefer small cozy restaurants to giant amusement park sized establishments.<br><br>I&#39;ve eaten at CF once in my life, and I doubt I&#39;ll ever go back.  Some friends of mine invited me one Friday evening last summer, so I sucked up my courage and braved the traffic and drove out to Easton.  Found parking with no more than normal difficulty, and successfully navigated the mazelike restaurant to the table where my friends were seated.  The free bread was quite tasty, so things got off to a good start.  The service must have been fine because I don&#39;t remember anything particular about it.  We ordered drinks, which were very expensive and not all that strong, though tasty.  Those things, and the cheesecake itself, were the plusses.  On the minus side: the menu was gigantic and not vegetarian-friendly.  I tend to find large menus, like large restaurants, a bit overwhelming.  I ordered the grilled eggplant sandwich which sounded like a manageable veggie dinner to eat and still have room for cheesecake.  Not so much!  I ended up with a huge pile of fries surrounding what seemed like a loaf of greasy bread filled with eggplant, red peppers, and a half a pound of cheese.  It was the greasiest, messiest, most unmanageable &#34;sandwich&#34; I&#39;ve ever seen.  I think I ate a third of the sandwich, half the fries, and of course a slice of cheesecake, and consumed more fat than I&#39;d had all week.  Yuck!  The restaurant was very loud and crowded, and, like I said earlier, had all the ambience of a theme park.<br><br>Two stars - one for the cheesecake, one for the free bread and fancy drinks.  Nothing for the food or the atmosphere.  But maybe that&#39;s just me.
I like this place for dinner with the in-laws there is something for everyone on the 20 page menu. It does get crowded around dinner so get your name on the list early!

Extensive menu. Portions are way too big but that&#39;s not a bad thing if you like leftovers for two nights like I do. The food is above quality bar and grill fare. Not very many low-fat options but I generally don&#39;t go out to eat for low-fat meals as I eat enough of those at home.

The food is excellent, the atmosphere is beautiful, and the service is always much greater than the service I get at other chain restaurants. I have been here about five or more times and each time it has been awesome.

Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t a favorite of mine, but somehow I end up going there about 5 or 6 times a year. I don&#39;t complian. It&#39;s always a decent experience. This is how it goes down. There&#39;s always an annoying wait evern if it&#39;s 3PM on Friday or 10PM on Saturday, and fuggedaboudit during peak times. So, anyway, you&#39;re waiting and people are everywhere, not dressed appropriately for dinner, carrying shopping bags and pushing strollers. That&#39;s Easton for ya! Then your name gets called and you&#39;re so excited! The seating is meant to get as many people in as possible which takes away from the ambiance, but you get over it when you get your bread (eat the brown kind) and then order drinks. Their mixed drinks are THE BEST! Whoever is their bartender, they should get 5 stars! Anyway, you go through the HUGE menu, pick something that sounds good, you get the huge plate of food. It is pretty good. You can&#39;t finish, you may or may not get cheesecake to-go. You get the bill and are shocked at how much you&#39;ve spent. Pay and tip for the attentive service and try to rush out through the crowded hostess coral. That&#39;s was a nice time, wasn&#39;t it?

I&#39;m not a huge Cheesecake Factory fan but this one was bad even for me.  The service is painfully slow and the servers have an attitude every time.  Food is decent but nothing fantastic.  Best thing is the cheesecake, as you would expect, but even that is not mind-blowing.
No matter what you&#39;re in the mood for, they&#39;re going to have a large portion and it&#39;s going to taste great!  Drinks are over-priced but it&#39;s a great place for dinner.

My wife and I have been searching for a place that offers the classic Eggs Benedict.  Since The Cheesecake Factory offers this item on their Sunday Brunch menu, we decided to give it a try on 12/2/2012.  I couldn&#39;t have been more disappointed.  My wife ordered French Toast and bacon, and I ordered the Eggs Benedict with Canadian Bacon and Hollandaise sauce.  After an extremely long wait for our food to arrive (it wasn&#39;t crowded or busy at 10 AM), my wife was presented with her French Toast, but no bacon.  Apparently, the bacon was not ready.  The worst offense was my Eggs Benedict was presented with a greasy and broken Hollandaise sauce.  When our waitress came back to ask if everything was okay, I informed her that my dish had to go back to the kitchen.  She didn&#39;t ask why, and picked it up and returned to the kitchen.  I did overhear her saying the sauce was broken, so at least our waitress knew the dish was unacceptable.  What I can&#39;t fathom is why the kitchen would send such a disaster out to the table in the first place.  The second attempt was no better than the first.  The sauce was again broken.  Apparently, there was no chef working that had passed basic sauces at culinary school.  Now here is the absolute worst offense.  As I had been craving Eggs Benedict, I decided to eat the second dish as I was also hungry and didn&#39;t want to waste further time having them fix me something else.  During my meal, I was presented with a flour-thickened Hollandaise sauce.  That should have been criminal!  It isn&#39;t called Hollandaise GRAVY, it&#39;s supposed to be an emulsification!  That had to be the worst offense from the kitchen.  Needless to say, the manager did remove the Eggs Benedict from the check - I wouldn&#39;t have paid for it anyway.  The service was good. The waitress was sympathetic.  The transgressions on the kitchen were unforgivable.  We had been past fans of The Cheesecake Factory, but after this experience, we won&#39;t be going back.  I cannot suffer a kitchen that just doesn&#39;t care about the quality of the food they are producing.
